Title: was not what i wanted

Review: ive been an avid reader from the moment i first learned to read this means over the years i have collected tons of books sure ive downsize plenty of times gave books away to friends or donations but still somehow before i knew it i once again has too many books and no place to store new ones it was a vicious cycle so i as much as i was against them i decided to get an ereaderi originally had a nook color and that was my first introduction into ereaders it was great for graphic novels and comics but not so much for actual novels my eyes would hurt and strain from the back light and text i also hated reading outside on a bright sunny day since all i would experience was glare while for the most part i was happy with it i could play games on it i was also extremely unhappy eventually my nook suffered extreme water damage so i was then in the market for a new ereader i tried to save myself some money by reading on my ipad but i encountered the same problems as i did with the nook painful strained eyes from the back light when reading for prolonged times and of course the dreaded sunny day glare which those of us with ipads know that glare pretty much renders them useless since you cannot see a thing plus my ipad is a bulky 2nd generation and because of the weight it gets pretty tiring holding that thing for a lengthy time reading because of my inability to comfortably read i started buying physical books again and once again ran out of room to store themi started doing my research on some basic ereaders such as the kindle kindle paperwhite and the nook glowlight i didnt want one of the tablet ereaders since i already had an ipad so why do i need all the bells and whistles so i compared each of the ereaders i was interested in and the nook glowlight was originally winning the race since i had a whole library of ebooks purchased from barnes and noble from my previous device and the price was excellent 100 bucks for basically the bn version of the kindle paperwhite it was cheaper than buying the paperwhite from amazon but then prime day happeneda basic kindle with special offers for 50 bucks soldi had heard of the pricing when sales had leaked a few days before prime day and i told a few people i knew i was buying a kindle my husband pointed out a few things such as there is no backlight well the backlight was my main issue with my previous ereader and my ipad so no backlight no problem what about your previous barnes and noble library i already read them all ill buy new books again no problem what if you want to read in the dark i turn on a light problem solved and last but not least dont you think the special offers will get annoying nope in fact something might catch my eye and it will serve more like a recommendation on what to read next i had it all figured out i was buying a kindlethe day my kindle came i was so excited that i immediately set it up i took advantage of a trial month of kindle unlimited so i started reading right away i am beyond thrilled i made this purchase the kindle so far has lived up to my every expectation granted i have only had the device for 5 days i have no issues with my eyes hurting or straining while reading i have been able to take advantage of a breezy summer day by reading in my backyard without an issue of glare from the sun the photo ive included with my review is the clearness of the screen outside on a sunny day i was so impressed with the lack of glare i immediately took a picture with intentions of adding it to this review the weight of the kindle is practically nothing so it doesnt become annoying holding it for a prolonged reading session im also very impressed with the battery life ive been reading daily for about an hour or so each day and i havent needed to charge my kindle yet except for the initial charging when it arrived i also love the ability to use amazon household to share libraries my husband uses the kindle app on his tablet so i am able to read what he reads on my kindlei am extremely happy to have bought a kindle which originally i would have never done so if it hadnt gone on sale during prime day but i will admit that would have been so foolish because even at 79 dollars the kindle with special offers is worth every penny

Review: although i love kindles in general i gave this 4 stars mainly in comparison to the other versions available i actually purchased this kindle for my son and the paperwhite for myself and i find myself now wishing that i had just purchased two paperwhites the standard kindle without advertisements is about 99 and the kindle paperwhite with advertisements was 119 but that extra 20 gets you a much improved screen and a reading light that really comes in handy the reading light is especially useful for me because i read to my son when he goes to bed my advice is to just buy the paperwhite itself and not worry about the case or charging adapter because you could buy similar items of the same quality from other makers for much cheaper than the 50 and 20 respectively with regards to whether or not to get one without the advertisements you have to pay extra to get one that is advertisementfree i normally hate advertisements but these ones are really unobtrusive because they only occur when the kindle isnt being actively used i don’t own a kindle voyage but i used a friends voyage and i didn’t see anything that really justified the extra price the screens look basically the same and the only major difference is the sensors that automatically adjust the reading light which might be important for some people but probably not so much for most users

Review: i received my kindle 6 as a gift and didnt know much about them or if i would even find much use for it boy has this device changed my life i detest reading i read only if a job or problem requires it i never made time for reading prior to owning my kindlefirst of all when i powered on my kindle it welcomed me personally and thanked me for my purchase somehow it ties to the account it was purchased with unless otherwise specified cool creepy in some ways but cool skeptical i continued to operate the device and was guided to download a couple free books with my prime membershipi purchased a couple titles on the off chance that i had some time where my internet was out or i was stranded somewhere with no cell phone service so i still had something to do a week after owning my kindle we had a tornado watch in which my family gathers in a safe spot until the watch downgrades to a warning all my mobile devices were occupied by other family members waiting patiently for the storm to pass so i picked up my kindle and began to explorei began reading and immediately paid attention to the line numbers page numbers percent completed and estimated time remaining cool i activated wordwise which identifies key words sentences characters and events and gives me a brief summary when i go a few days without reading wordwise can quickly remind me where im at in the story neat kindle also never loses my place whether reading on kindle my iphone ipad or desktop pc thats convenient lastly i can store hundreds of books on my kindle and infinitely more in the cloud so theres no bulk besides the device itself no clutterive now added several more books to my amazon wishlist and will wait for them to go on sale but my reading habits have changed and its all thanks to kindle kindle makes reading enjoyable in an increasingly digital world

Review: i returned this item because of a single major flaw pdf rendering its great for everything elsei use lots of pdf books and a lot of them are scanned books with pages in the jbig2 compression algorithm this is the best bw image compression routine ever invented you can have a 300dpi book 6x9 pages 400 pages all in maybe a 7mb file size its awesomebut kindle cant properly render jbig2 compressed pdfs its like someone went through the book and randomly erased characters like to the tune of half a dozen characters from every page just gone for e ample im gine h w hard it wo ld be to re d somethi g with lots of mi sing chara tersive used these same pdfs with dozens of other devices and software packages and they always show perfectly except on kindle seems to be a universal problem with kindle pdf rendering engine because ive seen the same thing in multiple kindle eink devices and even on a friends kindle firei know this is a very specialized problem and probably wont affect a lot of people at all but if you need good pdf supportprobably ought to look elsewhere

Review: i took advantage of the trade in program to get the extra 25 toward a new kindle i boxed up my old one and sent it off to amazon after they accepted it i ordered the new touch screen modelwhy an eink reader well i travel a lot for work and like to read i already stare at lcd screens all day so the eink is softer on my eyes why kindle well no matter how you look at it the amazon ecosystem is top notchso how does the latest version stack up first off the software is touch friendly and a little easier to get around you can long press a word to get a definition instead of navigating to it via a button you can press the top of the screen to get back to your home screen and choose a new reading material want to read a book just tap it to open it turn a page tap it and give a little swipe in the direction you want to go swipe it left to go to the next page right go back to a previous page it works pretty well and seems very snappy i would argue that the screen is not as sensitive as a phone or ipad but that is a good thingsee the touch can get in the way at times i have accidentally turned the more than i ever did on my old kindle i would almost be in favor of a hardware button to accomplish this kind of annoying but i can live with it my other issue deals with the sleep wake button it is on the bottom of the device and i have accidentally hit that a few times while reading i wish that while in a book amazon would use the button to trigger a dialog box that popped up asking if that was an accident or if you really wanted to send the device into sleepoverall i am impressed i like the reader the screen is sharp and responsive the touch screen can be both an upgrade and an annoyance but overall i prefer it i am glad i updated

Title: the 6 glarefree touichscreen kindle is a huge step backwards

Review: this is my fifth kindle all the others died of a shattered screen except my first generation and my kindle fire hd my first generation kindle is simply so hard to handle and use compared to later models that it spends most of its time in the closet most of my other kindles were the keyboard type model d00901 i loved them but the screens were too fragile and the fourway navigation switch was so tiny that i needed a special tool to use it so for my fourth kindle i got a kindle fire hdmy kindle fire is an amazing device but it has several drawbacks the worst drawback is that the moment i step outdoors the screen goes dim and the faint image that remains is totally lost in the glare from the very shiny screen i have a handicap that prevents me from driving so i travel a lot by bus which means that i spend a lot of time waiting at bus stops i like to carry a kindle with me to read while waiting so i need one that works outdoors it just happens that a local store happened to have a used touch screen kindle on sale at a very low priceas other commenters have said it came without a wall plug adapter but this was no problem since i still had the adapters from the old broken kindles as well as the adapter from my kindle fire hd all of these are usable on my touchscreen except for the first generation in addition my local supermarket carries a pack of various usb connectors and an adapter that works just as well so i didnt have to send for an amazon adaptergoing from a keyboard to touch screen did take some learning time and i am still learning some things luckily this kindle unlike the kindle fire comes with a complete and easy to read users guide the more i use the touchscreen the more assured i am that i will never go back to the keyboardyou will need a couple accessories if you want to keep your screen clean and free of fingerprints you need a stylus basically this appears to be an aluminum tube with a soft rubber tip on one end and a pocket clip on the other unlike your fingers the rubber does not generate skin oils and is easy to wipe clean of any dirt it may pick up also since the point of the stylus is much smaller than your fingertip it is much more accurate i was able to order a pack of about twenty of these for a couple bucks from an auction site in china which gave me plenty to share with friends and still have lots of sparesthe one absolutely necessary accessary is a cover your kindle is a fragile device and needs to be protected from rough handling weather and the other things in your purse there are many different kinds of covers available online and at local electronic stores first pick one that fits your model of kindle different models of kindle have onoff volume control and wireless switches in different places the wrong cover may prevent access to these switches second pick one that is very sturdy mine came with a neoprene bag which offered some protection from shock but did nothing against bending stress bending stress is a main cause of shattered screens and a shattered screen turns your kindle into a very expensive piece of trash the stronger your case the safer your kindle is so get the best cover you can affordmy touch screen kindle is the best ive ever owned for a person buying their first kindle or a person who wants a handy go everywhere reading device look no farther the only improvement that i would like to see is to make one with a seven or eight inch screen i am a fast reader and would like one where i do not have to turn the page so often

Title: there is nothing like a plain kindle 6 for reading

Review: i got this thing as a refurb and its basically brand new i can see nothing that would suggest much use for sure no problems with the screen as of now and the touch mechanism to me is working perfectly updating the thing was a breeze so lets get into detail on the devicethe normal kindle i suppose is the poor mans ereader at this point in amazons lineup but i am waiting until the 16nm tablet revolution to get one of their highend tablets i didnt want to pay more than i needed for something that i just read text on and the paperwhite seems to have its fair share of screen problems this one was only 64 dollars base price i got a used case to go along with itfor that price the device is positively charming its my first kindle and i really could not ask for more amazons software if very mature at this point so you have a variety of fonts readability settings and core attributes to modify to your liking after a couple minor fixes for my own personal use i was off downloading my entire kindle on pc library easy fast i could not ask for anything easier the experimental browser also gets the job done bookmarks and decent website compatibility as long as it doesnt use too much flash or java the device works perfectly for a college accessory and textbook device when needednot all textbooks are compatible with the lower end devices though that was the only downside to the cheapest one in the lineup my glossary of literary terms was sadly not okay with this ereadernavigating and using features like highlights xray dictionaries and the page functions took about 20 minutes for me to get the hang of it all again everything is set up to help the customer get up and running very easily the various swipes are easy to remember and incredibly intuitive at this point i can flip preview cancel and just all around enjoy the book i am reading without hardly any hassle at all i for one did not think the page turning was too sensitive on mine seems about right for such a device amazon clearly has some very mature software here that complements the kindle hardware in synergistic fashioni dont use too many of the community features like goodreads but that is there for you too if you want to be involved in the gigantic kindle community other great community functions that are less pervasive include notes on what people highlighted in the book which i found to be a nice feature and then you have other functions like about the book which gives you some really nice info about what you are reading the first timethe one thing some people are going to not like is probably the storage 4gbs is not really what i call enough space for the future luckily i do have a lot of delphi collections and my books fit on here nicely at this point i have about 23gbs left after dling 70 or so products amazon itself has its own helpful user guide for you to dl right off the bat so if you do ever get lost that thing should save you a lot of timethe resolution of the display seems fine to me and very close to what you would get in a normal sized book the somewhat dim display works very well for and is basically about the brightness of a normal literature page i was comparing it to a bunch of my books and came away quite pleased with what they have here of course a bit more resolution would be nice but for what is here you can still get fairly small fonts and good detail this is not a reader for the dark obviouslyanyway i dont think there is too much else to say ill update the review as i go along and take a note on battery life but for now this thing is a great little device cheap fast easy to use and all around a nice product to own with good and simple build quality it syncd up with my amazon account right away and there was absolutely zero trouble getting this thing to work correctly highly recommended to those on a budget or to those that do not have any need for the higherend tablets and readers unlike some of the other products this one doesnt have any inherent screen issues either
Title: a nifty device

Review: this is my fifth or sixth kindle over the years while i am a bit oldfashioned and love having a good old paper book this kindle works for me life changes for us all and mine is no exception we downsized from a goodsized home in the suburbs to an apartment in the city gone is the luxury of having an extra room to serve as an office and libraryi feel lost if im traveling without something to read there always seems to be some sort of delay whether waiting for a plane or train or just the doctor having a book handy is always the perfect remedy having a kindle is even better because its quick and easy to switch to something that i feel like reading at that particular momenti have had a couple of the other glare free or paper white kindles and have always loved them they all met their end due to serious use and ultimately something dumb on my end from pushing on a pen hard enough on my leather case to damage the screen underneath to an unexpected swim in the toilet ive broken a few the second to last found me buying the kindle fire sure the web browsing colorful and glass ugh screen were nice the biggest drawback was the battery that just didnt last and would run out when i wanted to read something the most did i mention i break things yup that one still worksif you can see through the cracks in the glassi finally wised up and got what i realized i needed a lightweight basic reader that holds all my content and the battery seems to last forever its not pretty and sometimes it gets a little tricky to change pages as the swipe isnt as crisp as the others i have had still there is no glare like the fire can have on sunny days its small yet easy to read with or without reading glasses as the font is adjustable i use a light leather cover and its held up very well even to my standardsif you are looking for all the bells and whistles keep looking if you are looking for a portable easy to use and see companion for your everyday travels and dont want to worry about your battery crapping out then this model is something youll appreciate great functional tool for the job

Review: i have been a happy amazon customer for over a decade with a purchase history of six kindles for myself and family but this touchscreen display kindle is not in any way an upgrade from the previous version with buttons on the consolefirst the kindle will for no reason whatsoever simply change the font size usually from my preferred third smallest to the largest or occasionally again for no reason whatsoever to the absolute smallest its a piamore an obstruction however is the sensitivity of the touchscreen you can touch the right hand portion of the screen with your finger in order to advance to the next page but if your finger hovers a second over the screen it will quickly advance numerous pages as much as 1020 pages which makes determining where the hell you were immensely difficult i am in the habit of reading my daily new york times on the kindle and this causes perennial problemsanother troubling aspect with sensitivity is how by just holding the kindle if your thumb or a finger touches the screen you change the page or call up some featurethe touchscreen is such a problem that i have considered buying a used older version that no longer is offered new but the battery would be so old that battery life would likely be almost nonexistent i know that you can buy replacement batteries but that is a lot of work just to get a decent previous version of a kindle because the newer version is substandardamazon you arent apple i wont be buying your technology if its introduced faulty from the getgo especially when i can use other readers to do what the kindle doesi am leaving this review with two stars not because i am pleased with the reader which i have had for two months but because i am managing to still use it despite the impracticalities although i will buy either a new nonamazon replacement or an amazon working upgrade sooncaveat emptor

Review: i give the reader four stars only because i give five stars only for a product that is truly outstanding this kindle reader is very goodbut not outstanding that said it delivers for the price previously i bought the kindle voyage and own both an ipad and an android tablet without going into detail each has a use for me except for the old ipad i felt i needed reader but did not feel like paying the price of another kindle voyage this kindle gives value for the price a feature i like about both the kindle and the kindle voyage is their size i can stuff them into the pockets of just about any of my trousers just as i used to do with my soft back books as a kid and pull them out at any time navigating them is easy however i have to say that i find my android tablet much more functional in this regard but one must keep in mind this is a reader not a tablet one needs ambient light to read not with the voyage though but cannot surf the net or take or download pictures as one does with a tablet on the other hand the kindle sips energy i am a voracious reader so i had to charge my tablet daily not the kindle reader i can drag the thing with me wherever i go and pull it out anytime anywhere confident that i will be able to tune out and read i admit i do bang it around did the same thing with my books as a kid still i did not buy the cover as i did with the voyage i wanted to cut down on its weight this has proven to be a good call at first glance the screen seems miniscule but after use one finds it quite sufficient the font can be modified as well as the size of the print to my delight the kindle also has the dictionary function that i used so much in my voyage and tablet i would recommend the old kindle as an everyday knockabout reader to anyone

Review: i have had this kindle for a few weeks now i have grown to appreciate it for what it is what i mean by that is this device met most of my expectations but i have found that i may have had unrealistic expectations i had expected that it would have the capability to display books in color it never occurred to me that a device made in this day and age would have a black and white only display this is not a complaint as such just headsup for others who might not have considered this i reread the description of this device on amazon and did not find any reference to it being black and white only i could have missed it or they may have rectified it by nowit is however fantastically suited for textbased book reading which is of course its primary function the fonts are a little chunky when viewed up close but resolve themselves very nicely when viewed at normal reading distance if the font size is increased slightly it becomes very comfortable for my mature eyes to read it is useful even on lowlight situations it is easily much more legible than a book for reading in any given situation it is much more comfortable to hold than most books i find myself overbending the spine on my paperbacks so that i can clearly read the print that is near the foldthe experimental browser has worked moderately well for basic internet browsing but is of course also hobbled by the fact that the device is only black and whitei paid 20 for the adfree version but received the one with ads i contacted amazon and got an almost instant reply with an offer to refund the 20 or send me another i opted for the 20 refund and am glad i did the ads dont bother me at all and if i truly dont want to see them i can turn it off i would almost say it is an advantage to have the advertising because it gives me ideas on what to read nextas a side note i will post a picture that fans of the hitchhikers guide will appreciate as soon as i finish my current project

Review: the digital age of book reading has been great for me a voracious reader since the age of seven to be able to find download and begin to read a book within a matter of minutes is nothing short of amazing when it happened i could not make the switch from paper books to the digital variety fast enoughi purchased my first kindle years ago while i enjoyed reading books on it the screen left much to be desired amazon’s early kindle operating system was faulty in that it didn’t always recognize input when touching the screen the new version for 2014 has rectified many of those issues while maintaining its very small form factor but it has not all together eliminated the touchy os problems there is still a notable lag when pressing a button onscreen and there is also a delay in showing text while typing on the virtual keyboard none of these or other minor flaws takes away from how great the kindle isimg5325the latest kindle sports a 6inch nonglare screen in a very thin small formfactor that is perfect for people who dislike bulky tablets it has wifi plus a 20 faster processor than the kindle from 2013 a speedier processor means pages are redrawn faster on screen giving an Review: i got this for christmas so have been using it for about 3 months i really enjoy reading most books on the kindle the text is very clear and as advertised works in bright sunlight the screen also is designed so that you dont really notice smudges or fingerprints while reading its much lighter and smaller than a paper book so its perfect for reading on the bus and i love that i can get ebooks from my library straight to my kindle the battery life is incredible i can read quite a few novels before needing to recharge and one of the biggest selling points of the devicehowever it is not a robust device i bought a sleeve for it to protect the screen and kept my kindle in the sleeve whenever i was taking it anywhere i still ended up with 3 scratches on the screen in less than 3 months so ive had to put a screen protector on my kindle which means i no longer have a glarefree screen it seems like its either keep the kindle screen as is unprotected and enjoy the glarefree matte finish but have lots of scratches or use a screen protector and read with glare but no scratches except the ones that are already there from the 3 months without a screen protector i am very disappointed that my screen scratched so easily because i was quite careful with my kindle in general another thing that i find irritating is that lint seems to get stuck between the screen and the black plastic casing and is very hard to remove this is more of a nuisance than a real issue until you go to put a screen protector on then the lint creates air bubblesoverall i would cautiously recommend a kindle to someone looking for an ereader but im very glad i didnt spend more than 59 on it bought during christmas promotions i would advise anyone to buy some sort of sleeve or case for your device immediately and use it diligently to avoid scratches on the screen id also advise getting a screen protectorbut give yourself a few days to enjoy how great reading on the kindle is before compromising the reading experience with a screen protector

Review: ive had 3 different models of kindles from one of the earliest with the keyboard and wifi3g to the paperwhite with the lit back to this one and my opinion of them remains unchanged they are the best thing to happen to people that love reading and honestly this is the best model for most people this is why🔘 touch screen nearly everyone is used to touch screens by now and this kindle is no different its easy to turn the pages but now it is also easy to type notes or search a book even compared to the older models with a full keyboard since im so used to touch typing and one smaller thing turning the pages via the touch screen means i dont have to reach to the corner of the device to turn the page as i did with the older model with the edge buttons🔘 eink display look like a real book seriously its only 167 ppi but thats part of the reason it does in most of the paperback and hardcover books ive read in the past the font was always almost a bit grainy just naturally due to the printing process at the time and i know this isnt intentional here with the kindle but thats what it reminds me of and why it feels like a real book🔘 no back light not a downside to me since any place i read i would have enough light anyway i have a lamp at home planes have individual lights and my office has plenty of lighting studies have even shown that reading in low light does not damage eyes it only strains them temporarily and finally and this is huge if you read before bed the lack of a backlight means less blue light directly into your eyes to affect your brains sleep cycle so youll fall asleep more readily🔘 crazy battery life definitely related to the eink display and lack of a backlight the kindle will stay in standby mode forever seriously i charge it once every month or two when i use it sparingly and when i take it on 12 week vacations i never have to charge it this is honestly the best thing about it since sure you could use your smartphonetablet to read books but both of those will rarely if ever last as long as the kindle and thats assuming you have them in airplane mode at the lowest brightness its nice to have a device that you can pick up always knowing its got charge🔘 slightly thickerheavier i say this since compared to the older hard buttons entry level model its a tiny bit thicker as well as heavier this is insignificant to me but its definitely noticeable likely due to the added hardware of a touchscreen display🔘 wifi only obviously used to sync book and it works great at that and quickly since books are pretty small in file size you can even look up your kindle email address in your amazon account and mail yourself personal pdfs or documents theres also a web browser in the kindle though so you could use this device as a last resort if your smartphonelaptoptablet are out of battery🔘 file storage this is actually really nice since you can save files just as if it was a usb flash drive onto the kindle as well as manually load books from your pc if you have any availableoverall this is an amazing device and indispensable for those that love reading but dont have space or money for a library also great for travelers who like to pack light such as myself

Review: i love reading but i am consumed by a digital age i spend so much time playing video games and on social media i hardly give myself the time to sit down with a good booki have a phone a computer and a tablet each with access to the kindle app but the lights can often cause extreme fatigue when reading for long periods of timei could pick up physical copies of books and read those but often times the font is too small for my bad eyesight and larger books can be hard to read due to the pages curvingenter the kindle this ingenious little device fixes every problem i have experienced with digital and physical readingbecause it does not light up i do not experience the same fatigue as when reading on my other devicesi have the ability to increase font size all the way to the point of each letter being about 12 tall the flat design makes it easy to read in any position i can even put it on a tablet stand and read handsfreeit is extremely lightweight and does not cause my arms to become tired like large hardcover books do in some positionsthe library of books is incredible i can read almost any book i want though there are many that are not yet on the kindle storethe battery life is phenomenal i havent charged it in 2 months and am just now getting a low battery alert it takes a standard microusb connectionover all this is an excellent device and encourages reading in the digital age

Review: got this as a replacement for my keyboard kindle which died of old agethe prossmall and light enough to fit in my purse print is clear and easy to read and customizable so you can pick the font face and size that are easiest on your eyesthe cons1 not really in love with the touch screen it seems really sensitive ive blown on it before to remove a crumb and the page changes the kindle tends to get turned on in my purse and when i take it out to go to lunch it is on a completely different book and the font size is either huge or tiny as it gets touched by things in my purse2 another meh to me is that the screen can apparently be bruised if something touches it too hard theres a small smudge on the screen that is not removable its not really in the way but its in the perfect location to make me occasionally look at a word twice3 and finally i am so not in love with the interface making a collection is time consuming and confusing and some of my books for whatever arcane reason show up in the book list multiple times i cannot make it stop i dont know if this is specific to this hardware of if its a universal problem but its really annoying when trying to organizeoverall not bad i like that its not backlit since i work on a computer all the time and can get eyestrain wish i had my old keyboard though if you get one get a case though and be ready to rebuild your collections i wish amazon would create an interface on their website where you can create your collections that would transfer to a new device when an old one dies creating collections on a touch screen is a pain in the tail

Review: im so pleased i bought this kindle for me its hard to convince myself that a kindle is needed in addition to my laptop smart phone and just hard copy books in general but ive been proven sorely wrong on those objectives i will stop at work sometimes and read from this kindle because my eyes start to hurt from looking at my computer screen all day the special tinted screen is excellent at protecting your eyes and the tablet is small and lighter than most books battery life is long i have gone months without needing to charge mine due to the devices minimal use of batteryas for the functionality of the kindle its better than any hard copy book although it doesnt have the refreshing smell of a new book from your home screen you have the option to select a book you can have more than one book on your kindle at once you can also search for or select a book ad that amazon offers you on your kindle if your kindle is connected to a wifi and buy it on your kindle from your amazon account while reading your book you can tap words and get definitions of the words you can also tap characters in your book and the kindle will give you a quick background on who the character is and their part in the story you can highlight parts of your book as well as leave notes in certain places that you can look back at lateryou can also buy a book on your laptop or any device that you can use amazon on and it will upload the book to your kindle when your kindle accesses internet if you want to demo a book to read a sample and see if you like it amazon will send you a sample for free that you can read on your kindle as well if you have amazon prime there are excellent deals on kindle books as well as a whole library of free books you can read

Review: as a basic ereader the latest kindle does a great job i have no complaints for what it was meant to do but there is one thing that bothers me and that is the battery life after only about a week of using it it seems half my battery is drained after reading through 300 pagesnaturally i was thinking that maybe ive gotten a faulty battery there was no manual or technical details in the amazon description to see the battery capacity i then saw some very small wording on the back of the kindle itself to see input 525v max 500ma it hit me ive been using too high of a current to charge my battery and as a result have deteriorated the battery health the charger that amazon suggests to use has a 1a output or 1000main my opinion amazon is pulling some form of planned obsolescence not only is 1a the most common output for a usb charger but its next to impossible to find one with a slower charge im going to end up charging my kindle from my computer whenever im already on it from now on in efforts to keep the longevity of the battery computer usb 20 ports output a maximum of 500ma

Review: i really never saw myself as wanting one of these type devices ive always been a hardcore real book person however after reviewing this particular device and catching it on sale 59 i decided to take the plunge i love this reader it is very simple and straightforward easy to navigate ive not purchased any books yet but did borrow a few from my public library transfer rate was very quick amazon is the middle man on this so you do need an amazon account to borrow bookssome of the reviews i read mentioned that they did not like the touch screen vs older versions having buttons personally i like the touch screen the other issue folks talked about was the device not having a back light again i dont see any problems with thisthis unit features 8 different font sizes 6 different fonts and 3 different display settings for line spacing and margins respectively i did some tweaking to suite my personal tastes and have been very happy with the way i can read the size is just about right to be held with one hand the screen is easy to read once you get it adjusted to your liking the battery i cant really comment on yet ive charged it fully but not sure of how long it will last the only thing i was surprised about was the fact that you cannot completely turn the unit off when you hit the power button on the bottom of the unit you are given 3 options cancel restart and screen off i have been using the screen off option the unit has a nice feature involving a dictionary if you touchhighlight a word you will get a display screen from the on board dictionary complete with definition of the word there are also links for wikipedia and goodreads to name a few for these you need to be connected to wifi this wasnt very intuitive there is a mode called airplane mode in the settings when you are in airplane mode the wifi is disconnected to connect simply take the airplane mode offas with any device you have to take in to consideration what you want to device to do for you for me i chose this not only for the good reviews but because i was only looking for a device to use for reading books not surfing emailing etc this is why i chose this and not a tabletthe only additional purchases i needed to make an have done so were for a case and a power adapter this unit comes with a usb charging cable but i prefer to use a regular wall power adapter i found one marked down at walmart for 10 the case i did find on amazon and will review that separately

Review: i love this device when they first came out i was against them only recently after watching some videos by others did my interest get peeked enough to write out a procon list the ereader won by a lot yes the regular book is very special and unique a classic always but the ereader makes it more efficient and user friendly the device is very light weight and easy to hold compared to regular paperbacks and hard covers two of the best qualities for this device is 1 it can hold several thousands books no more bulk carrying or having a hard time deciding which book to bring with you out of the house you bring them all 2 the builtin dictionary and online wifi ability to search further on words terms and phrases pricing for ebooks tied for pro and con as some books can be very cheap while others either the same or more expensive than the actual book but the other pros outweighs this cons in the end you will save money throughout buying your collection you will also never have to buy an addition copy due to losing the book giving it away or damage that can be very easy one book i had bought 4 times due to poor binding style but now i will never have to buy again id highly recommend the ereader to anyone it doesnt mean you will never buy or read a regular book i still own books but mostly all my fiction and smaller novels are on ebook format while picture books and larger history study or research books i buy in regular format

Title: ebooks cost way too much

Review: reading on a kindle has become a tolerable experience pages flip with relative ease and there is a minimum of page refresh distraction unfortunately absolutely everything else about the experience ranges from annoying to impossibleon the hardware side the capacitative touch screen is insensitive and imprecise attempting to highlight text for example is a fiddly affair with the position of the cursors especially the endpoint often seemingly placed at random adjusting the cursors to the desired start and end points can be difficult even impossible every action seems to move at a snails pace my original ipad almost five years old now is a speed demon in comparison wifi connectivity is slow cantankerous and sometimes unreliable regardless of the actual signal strengththe software is a mess full stop it is slow ugly and violates just about every usability protocol for example important functions are often nested several layers deep because the menus are context sensitive a desired function may require several extra steps to access as it is only available in certain contexts the exact opposite effect context aware menus are supposed to have the software keyboard is particularly slow and unresponsive and its spelling suggestions can be bizarre forget a passcode or parental control password you have to reset the entire device which includes reregistering the device including reentering your amazon password going through the how to guide a step which cannot be skipped and readding all of your content manuallyamazon freetime unlimited which i subscribed to for my daughter is perhaps even less well laid out than the full kindle experience further the books included are rarely of any quality skewing towards product tie ins and lowrent graphic novels adding books from my full adult library which should be easy requires entering the parental password twice for no reason whatsoever after all the user has already entered the password to edit a freetime profile why should it be entered again to add booksin conclusion i dont expect this review to change anyones mind least of all amazons after all kindles keep selling and amazons selection of available content is nigh unbeatable if all you want to do is carry around a library and read its tolerable for any other purpose the headaches and frustration mount i couldnt for example imagine using a kindle for school where functions like highlighting and note taking become more important perhaps by the 15th or 20th generation the usability and responsiveness will rival a first gen ipad or for that matter my long departed handspring pda one can always hope

Review: so my kindle 3 finally crapped out on me it was a sad day since that thing had been handed down to me and gone through a lot it survived drops spills a busted and twice repaired usb port lost buttons and exposure to the elements in other words it was a true workhorse unfortunately one last drop was its untimely end and the screen finally succumbed to the abuse it had handled for 2 and half yearsi was a little weary about purchasing a new ebook reader as i prefer real concrete pages over electronic data but i had a lot of good memories with the past kindle and the thing served me well when amazon ran a valentines day special for the newest generation at a measly 60 bucks i couldnt resistits true ive had the device for less than 2 weeks and its true maybe its quirks will come out later but i dont see that happening the kindle 7 is a piece of technological art its not pretty in that sense but its a work of art in what it does and offersi mean itll hold thousands of books and the battery will last hundreds of hours ive used my continuously for a week and the battery is still more than half full not only that but its touch screen has wifi and is just the right size and speaking of right size the options for text size range from the very minuscule my favorite to the ginormous perfect for when i try to read at the gym its super light intuitive and insanely easy to useyeah it doesnt have a light and yeah its boring black and white but you know what who cares its for books books dont have lights and unless its a childrens book a coffee table time or a collectors edition the novel you just paid 10 dollars for is heavier takes up more space and most assuredly isnt in colorseriously though this kindle is awesome and i havent been happier with a technological device since my iphone 6 sure i predict ill be getting an ipad in the future but until then the kindle 7 is my ereader of choice and worth every penny

Review: ive been on something of a minimalist kick as of late envious of those adhering to the 100 or sometimes even less things challenge to eliminate clutter live more simply avoid retail therapy etc the kindle has been more or less on my radar since it came out but around christmas time last year a special promo sale on this the most basic model finally caused me to pull the trigger for the cost of a few books or to be fair the cost of the last technical book i bought i thought this was a very smart buy not only did i have a number of pdfs and kindle books i had already bought but i wouldnt worry about my things count or clutter level when continuing to buy booksthis reader is the most stripped down of the kindle line possibly ever though it does include a touch screen the form factor is good its the weight and dimensions it should be the display is good im surprised when im asked about eink type displays many more people than i would have guessed do not realize the difference between a screen like this and phoneipad display amazon probably doesnt help this matter by selling both backlit and androidderived tablets also under the kindle name the screen is worlds easier on your eyes than the laptoptablettv lcds were all so used to the text can obviously be adjusted to where you like it this must be a godsend for people who would ordinarily seek out largeprint books which are special orders and obviously not available for every bookthe touch screen functionality however is not that great its just not what were used to which to be fair is on much more expensive devices like the ipad while it works especially for opening books changing pages and such its tedious if you try and use it on the browser for example the way you might on a tablet although its not perfect id probably rather have this over a physical keyboard a la the early generation kindleson that note the kindle includes an experimental browser i think its quite literally called the experimental browser even which is a good way to manage the expectations of anyone using this feature its an utterly charming way to surf the internet if you ever wondered what the web would be like on a compact bw mac from 1991 here it is for me it tends to crash a lot as well but when its working properly its pretty cool seems to have a good amount of trouble connecting to public wifi that sends you to a portal page i havent looked into kindlefriendly web sites yet but i remain intrigued by this feature and glad its therethe battery life is excellent one of the best features for this in a world where noones anything is ever charged the features this particular model lacks only serve to prolong battery life i also appreciate that when connected to a computer this shows up as a drive and files can be dragged and dropped store purchases just show up when the kindle is on wifi and purchases are directed to send them there a wise choice considering how frustrating apple is with regards to the way itunes is required to manage those devicesall in all i am really happy with this product

even micro usb cable to work properly while the kindle seems to work regardless of cable or plugging into a number charger typesless than optimal i have yet to find a battery percentage on the kindle or 5 leftpage numbers the nook automatically calculates how many pages your book has based on the font and size you choose and then gives you a display saying page x of y the kindle gives you different options including page but it doesnt give you page x of y itll give you page number and x complete which again lacks specificity like the battery meter the nook has a touchscreen like the kindle for page turning but also has 4 buttons that can be configured for one handed reading and page turning without have to touch the screen i typically read with the item resting in my left hand which means to turn the page on the kindle i have to bring my right hand up and either swipe or touch the right side of the screen with the nook i can set the lower left button which i can reach with my left thumb to turn the page forward so my right hand can hold my drink or shoveling chex mix in without worrying about dripping spilling or getting the ereader grubbysimilar screen size case size although the kindle feels lighter i dont have a scale for these light weights and i havent checked the specs on both to compare but it does feel lighter the nook on the other hand has more of a rounded back which gives it a softer feel again that is personal preference on whether you would consider that a good or bad option in either case i dont have big hands and they both rest comfortably for long periods of timethe kindle is a solid performer but if comparing to the nook id give the nook a slight edge in the area of form and function when it comes to searching for books the next in the series and some other software type areas the kindle wins especially with prime

Review: first off i bought this at a great price 49 during the 2014 holiday season deals i am very happy with this purchase i have to admit i havent read many books in the past i didnt seem to have the time or want to sit and read a clunky book i normally get my reading fix from the internet or articles from a newspaper since i bought the kindle ive found myself reading more and wanting to read more booksthe kindle is light weight and simple to navigate at a little over six and a half ounces the kindle is easy to hold with one hand and when im done it disappears into my cargo pocket the touchscreen is very responsive and after about five minutes i knew all i needed to know about navigation and settings setting up the wifi was a breeze even with password protection downloading books and pictures were fast and simple even while using my horribly slow satellite internet service as for the special offers included with my kindle i thought that when i bought it id be seeing adverts popping up everywhere the only times ive seen an advert was while it was in standby mode so i dont have a problem with amazon showing me a few random things from time to timeanother great thing about the kindle is the battery life ive only had to charge it once since i bought it and that was 27 days ago that being said i turn off the wifi when im not downloading books or syncing i also only read about an hour or two a day so results may vary for some buyers really the only thing i could wish for the kindle is a microsd slot i know that it has cloud storage but i really would like to have multiple sdcards for multiple genre categories it would be nice for my personal preferences all in all this kindle is great and ive recommended it to a dozen people so far im very happy with my purchase and i will continue to use my kindle for as long as it lasts

long it will chug along i decided to bite the bullet when this was on sale i will say that the pages are much easier to read on this kindle and can even read in sunlight which i had trouble doing on my other one this kindle is much lighter but i actually prefer it a bit heavier touchscreen very responsive but i do prefer the physical buttons i realize that everything is going to touchscreen and most folks prefer that but am of the aarp generation and change is not always my friend i did find that i kept accidentally turning pages at times so i got a case which seems to help and adds a bit of volume which feels better to me since it is so much smaller than kindle keyboard one of the definite improvements is that apparently your collections are kept in the cloud so when i have to eventually replace it wont have to spend all that time reforming my collections my one big complaint is the reading progress option my old kindle has small black vertical lines along the bottom so you can see progress in each chapter this kindle gives the options of locations time left in chapter or book or nothing hate the locations option since it means nothing to me how about an actual page number option as far as the time left in chapter it is way off it currently shows i have one or two minutes left of reading but still have at least 6 or 7 pages left apparently my kindle thinks im a speed reader extraordinaire these are just minor annoyances and i can easily live with them since its so convenient and easy to use battery life is very good depending on how much im reading charge can last for one week if reading a lot or a lot longer if not reading too much battery will drain much faster if you leave wifi on so i just turn it on occasionally to sync or to download a book setup is very easy just make sure to have wifi available and know how to connect to it or you will be really frustrated i would also recommend getting a cover for it to keep screen clean and help prevent you from accidentally turning pages1218 update well i dont know if just coincidence but i received an update today you now have the option for a page number thanks amazon

Review: this review is targeted to those completely new to kindles since i noticed most of the other reviews seem to assume familiarity with other kindle productsmy background for the past five years ive been doing most of my book reading on either my ipad or iphone yes i find reading books on my phone quite comfortable actually the problem with both of them is the light theyre just too shiny to read in bed while im trying to fall asleepeven with the invert colors option turned on it was either get more and more paper books inconvenient or try something else hence the basic kindlei chose the basic kindle because despite reading a ton of reviews i couldnt figure out what was so great about the kindle paperwhite119 or kindle voyager199 compared with 79 for the basic kindle they have more bells and whistles but the core functionality appears to be the same so far i think i made the right choicecons1 it feels very cheap and plastic compared to an ipad but this is not surprising considering the price difference2 the screen responds very slowly scrolling through a large amount of text is painful but in reality this is not a problem since page turning inside a book is really the only thing you need to do most of the time and that part is fine3 if you dont pay the extra 2000 you get ads at the bottom of the home screen but these ads are not too obtrusive i dont plan on payingpros1 the screen is perfect for reading in bed because it emits no light its the same as reading a paperback of course you would need to have a lamp on but i think thats good as i dont think reading in the dark with just the light from an electronic device would be good for your eyes2 you can browse and buy books directly from the kindle warning your account is charged and books download instantly when you click buy there is no confirmation screen this is convenient if you know exactly what you want but its easier to do browsing on a regular computer due to the aforementioned painfully slow screen3 easy to use stays charged for a long timei havent tested their claim of weeks but based on the low power usage i could believe it automatically syncs across all your kindle device all the good things you would expectoverall i think this is good value if you1 read books in the sun where screen glare could be a problem2 want to read in bed and dont like the bright light from from most electronic displaysi cant say if the other more advanced kindle versions are worth the extra money but so far im liking this one

going to get this one instead of the paperwhitethe entry level kindle is not bad and honestly i like this one better than the previous generation which is what my boyfriend has i dont know why some people have a hard time navigating this kindle because i have had no problems with it yes sometimes i double click on a page by mistake but i can easily swipe back and i like how i can touch the top of the screen so i can get to the main menu truth be told i am a slow learner with electronics and i thought this version is easier to navigate than the last version with the last version i had a hard time going back and forth to the main menu and worrying about losing my place not with this kindle and its so easy for me to put bookmarks on this device that way i can flip through different pages and books and go back to where id like to readand i like that this kindle is easy on the eyes previously i was reading on my ipad which was such a pain the antiglare makes it so easy to zip through the pagesother tidbits no backlight kinda wish it did but this is the economy kindle dont expect to read this in dim lighting make sure you download overdrive or your local librarys app so you can send kindlefriendly books directly to your kindle ive borrowed several books that were transferred on my kindle no worries on late fees since the book is automatically returned when the loan period is up i dont know why amazon shows videos of all their kindles hovering over water this thing is not waterproof but i think most people know that you can browse the internet on a kindle but i dont recommend it for some moronic reason i did that out of curiosity and it froze my kindle shouldve known better given that its 4 gbsoverall im pretty satisfied with my kindle i expect to read on it for many years to come

Review: since so many of the reviews on this device are complaints about it not having a light function let me say this kindle does not have a frontlighti would like to use this review to convince you not to buy the paperwite or voyage by comparing things that are important to mereadability i know that this model has almost half the ppi 167ppi as the pw and voyage 300ppi and this is a big selling point for amazon but it honestly does not make that much of a difference when actually reading our brains do most of the work by recognizing symbols and shapes and filling things in so to speak that the text appears very crisp and very easy on the eyes with this device even with the lower ppi not a good reason to upgradereading in the dark the front light is such a gimmick not a good enough reason to upgrade imho since i can buy a darn good book light you know like we used back in the old days for 4 vs an extra 40 for the pw that has the same functionality as this model minus the light i had the pw first gen and the light was really blotchy and i personally noticed that my eyes strained when reading with that bluish white backlight for long periods at a time vs having the book light shining from above this is just a personal preference youll have to decide for yourself which you prefer i will say however that if your partner is very sensitive to light you might want to get the pw since you can turn the light down very low and squint to read that waydesign all 3 kindle models are pretty basic looking tbh not a good reason to upgrade this model does not have the rubbery back that the pw has and is a very smooth plastic that makes it very slippery in the hands i have found that both the pw and this basic model are very easy to scratch and ruin the screen as my keys did when i put the pw in my purse the good news however is that there are so many beautiful cheap cases on this site that remedy this i purchased the walnew kindle 7th gen colorful painting smartshell case the thinnest and lightest leather cover for amazon kindle with 6 glarefree touchscreen and it does not add any bulk to the device and has a textured feeling making it easy to hold when reading cons the basic and pw both have the indented screen that is forever catching dust and crumbs in the corners and it drives me nuts and the voyage is the only model that has the smooth front i refuse to pay 199 for a dedicated ereader thoughbattery life same on all 3 if you go easy on the light with the pw and voyage hasnt been an issue i should mention that none of the devices come with a wall plug but in this day and age honestly most people probably step on these regularly around the house i certainly dont need anotherthis basic model is the definition of good enough for its purpose as a dedicated ereader and since im mildly irritated at the rate amazon is cranking out these upgraded kindles i have made a list of things i consider worthy of an upgrade btw if your thinking about buying an older version of the kindle it is still supported and you can still buy ebooks to send to the devicethe only reason ill ever upgrade1 if amazon finally makes a waterproof kindle for reading in the tub or on the beach i have spilled tea on my basic kindle before and since there is not that many entrances like a headphone jack or something it survived just fine id feel more secure about reading in the tub if i knew it was tested as waterproof though2 if amazon brings back the headphone jack for listening to audiobooks i think they will probably have to make the storage expandable or offer more gbs if they do this since i think audio would take up more space than text if this a concern for you the kindle keyboard 3rd gen does have the headphone jack and im certain you can find a used one around going strongalso amazon seriously needs to get on the ball with the typography also very annoyed that epub is still not supported you can convert ebooks with calibre but its a hassle and that i am only allowed to lend books once for like two weeks

Review: this review is for the 7th generation kindle which is now touchscreen only and has no buttons except for the lockpower button all typing has been transferred to an inscreen keyboard popup i love mine but some people really like their old kindle with the qwerty keyboard buttons at the bottom in nay case the kindle is a great investment for bookworms with its multitude of features and has potential for webbrowsing on occasion especially if amazon improves on the experimental browser in the future see review below readability text scaling kindles eink technology recreates an experience similar to reading a paperback book i liken it to looking at an expensive etchasketch text is crisp and easily readable contrast excellent despite its screen size 3 w x 475 h or 9cm x 12 cm you can scale text from the very smallest all the way up to the very largest like a book reading in daylight or sun is not a problem but you may need sunglasses obviously at night youll need a light source to read send content to kindle from anywhere amazon cloud kindle servers will convert your content for the kindle for free works with most file formats even the text will be scalable pdfs however are not scalable and treated like an image all content you send to yourself will be stored on the amazoncloud drive 5gb of free storage be sure to read up on this cool feature i love it a definite plus for me httpwwwamazoncomsendtokindle libraries and ebooks many libraries in the us now allow you to access digital content not just ebooks and check them out while at home no visit to the library required i did this for the first time last week i checked out two ebooks process was easy and ebooks delivered to my kindle in under a minute if an ebook is checked out i can put a hold on it and optionally have it delivered to my kindle once it is available amazon will email you if a book becomes free or when a book is due be sure you learn how to return a book hint deleting will be required highlights annotations kindle has incorporated ways to highlight and annotate passages using your finger the best part is that all your markings and text will be uploaded to the cloud when you sync your kindle along with page location of the book access and manage them here at anytime this is a really cool feature when writing yourself notes to lookup things later httpskindleamazoncomyourhighlights dictionary wordwise keep learning words you dont know select an unfamiliar word and kindle will look it up for you using a standard dictionary andor wikipedia with a wifi connection kindle can even keep track of words youve looked up test yourself using the the flashcards feature wordwise is a predictive dictionary feature available in some books to suggest alternate meanings for complicated words in between lines of text preempting a dictionary search respected language dictionaries are available for english and most languages for free collections collections allow you to sort books into your kindle and sync across multiple devices instead of paging through multiple screens of all your content two important things to know before doing so collections are not file foldersmerely tags but it will appear as if your books are in a folder on the kindle but they actually are not collections created using kindle software apps on pc or mac will not sync to your actual kindle spare yourself my initial frustration and sort books into collections using only the a kindle or ipad trust me i called amazon upset because my collections wouldnt sync and update to the kindle from my computer apparently the syncing of collections was disabled a while but there is no documentation of this anywheredrawbacks experimental browser i like this feature but it is buggy you can use the experimental browser to surf the web amazoncom check email limited it will frequently crash especially with flash content which it does not support amazoncom is fine however so you can buy more ebooks the frustrating part is that when the browser crashesit reloads your last visited page a catch22 because it loads the page causing it to crash in the first place youll need nimble fingers to hit the back button or the stop loading x button in the address bar to resolve the crashing lighting it needs a light when it gets dark but that is because its supposed to be like a book solution kindle covercase with inbuilt or clipon light screen burstsreloads eventually you will get used to that splitsecond screen burst when the eink resets itself this is frequent but not always it just depends on the eink formatting needs from screen to screen remember the kindle is like a souped up etchasketch additional tips and recommendations bookmark your browser highlights annotations httpskindleamazoncomyourhighlightsmanage content settings httpswwwamazoncommndcwmyxhtmlamazoncloud drive httpswwwamazoncomclouddrive wifi vs whispernet be sure you learn the difference between sending content to yourself for free via a wifi connection or whispernet not free charges applyi havent used this feature so far kindle casecover protect your investment with a kindle case or cover i could imagine the screen getting scratched or marked by objects in a backpack purse or murse my 10 case should get here in a couple of days

Title: i do not like it

Review: first of all i should say that i do love my kindle this is my third before which i had a nook and to date i think this is the best i prefer this stripped down version to the fancier ones because just as with a car the more gadgets and added features there are the more parts there are that may break i would rather just read with the light on in the room than rely on a reader to light up for me i am an advance reader and i go through two or three books weekly the promise of a week of battery power is ridiculous because it doesnt take into account how much reading one does in a given daythose of us with arthritis have been assisted tremendously by the kindle sometimes i select very lengthy works that would be huge if i had to handle the physical book and because of arthritic issues i prefer this version of the basic kindle to the one i just wore out not having the buttons down the side but relying on a touch screen instead is far easier on the thumbs and highlighting by touch is far easier on the hands than having to navigate to each individual letter one click at a time this version makes it far easier to access footnotes and the dictionary but there are some kinks that still need to be worked outi use the features constantly since i am almost always reading a book with the intent of reviewing it the touch screen needs improvement trying to highlight too far left or too far right sometimes causes the page to turn unexpectedly trying to highlight in the topmost 20 causes the tool bar to pop up it is possible to highlight these areas but one has to touch it exactly straight on and hold for a moment and frankly its a pain in the butt in addition the keyboard has a terrible auto correct bar i have an android phone that can guess what i want to type very early but this one has no clue when using the secondary keyboard for punctuation the next word after the space bar is tapped should pop up as the main keyboard with letters but it doesnt we must move it back manually every stinking time and try the bookmark one cannot just tap the upper right corner because that will either bring up the tool bar or cause a letter nearby to be highlighted the only way to use the bookmark therefore is by first bringing up the tool bar then selecting bookmark then tapping a third time to verify that one wants to place a book mark in the cornerfor those that dont often use the features and just want to read the book and have the kindle remember your place its a pretty good reader the text is clear and the font size is easy to change without causing the paragraphs to go out of alignmentthe insidious suggestion that we link our goodreads account to our amazon account is the worst potential invasion of privacy i can imagine i began my toread list which has hundreds of titles with the casual intent to read those books if i ran across them it was never meant to be a wish list of course all i had to do there is ignore the prominent invitation to link my two accounts but its worth notingall told if i were going to buy an ereader again i would still choose this one i suspect it is the best on the market right now but i do hope amazon will also continue to work out the kinks in the features

Review: updated review i changed my rating from 3 stars to 2 stars for two reasons first the screen freezes at seemingly random moments when the backward tap and the menu tap do not work until i have tapped forward once second and more importantly the notes function is more difficult to use than it was with my older kindle the one with the button keyboard i use a kindle for two reasons convenience and the ability to increase font size the old kindle allowed font size for notes to be adjusted as best as i can determine note fonts on my new kindle can not be adjusted and i have difficulty reading them in addition the edit and delete labels are very small and it takes several attempts before the note is deleted instead the tap dismisses the note and then i have to go back to it and try againi also have to say that amazon promotes this kindle as having a better battery than the older one no way at best its just the sameas an aside i contacted amazon customer support to ask if note fonts could be adjusted and as usual they did not answer my question but sent instructions for adjusting book fontsoriginal reviewi had an older kindle with the button keyboard and switches on the side it is a perfectly fine device but the switches were starting to opoerate erratically so i decided to buy another kindle and got the 7th generation guy with the touchscreen just your basic ereader it is slightly easier to read on because all i have to do is tap the screen to turn the page but sometimes that seems to hang up a bit what i have a problem with is that learning how to use it is slightly less than intuitive and the onboard documentation is pretty bad the users guide is not indexed and the search function is clunky and lists all the results in a bunchedup sentence not in context if you want real documentation and instructions for how to perform various functions you have to use an online search enginei also struggled with transferring books from the old kindle because i had a lot of my own books on the old device which the new guy calls documents i finally got them all over but it took a while and the new device keeps giving me unnecessary warnings about syncing issues that function worked okay btwon the whole im okay with the new kindle especially as a physical object but the software could use a focus group

Review: this is a whole library that i can hold in one hand i love to read but have limited space in my house so it is really convenient to have this ereader where i can access a world of books it has my bible dictionary and other reference materials and i can access almost every book ever published i also find that many books are not issued in print anymore and i have them in my kindle collectionthings you should know about battery life i love that i can read for weeks with a single charge but you have to be careful and use a kindle knowledgeably because there are a few basic rules you must follow to prevent damage to the battery just call amazon kindle help before your first use and they will be able to help you get set up safely you shouldnt over charge and you shouldnt try to use the kindle while it is charging and you should never let it run completely down these things could damage the battery you should also know that a wifi internet connection drains the battery very fast only connect to the internet while downloading a book and when done disconnect from the internet for low energy reading you cannot replace the battery on a kindle so when youve used up all your charges you must discard this device and buy a new kindle i think if they wanted to they could make these to last but there is no profit in that so remember that kindles are disposable and your best course of action is to be aware of how to take care of your battery and give it maximum lifeanother drawback is that kindles are tiny they are not a good choice for cookbooks or for color magazines or for an atlas that needs a large page size to appreciate and kindles are black white only if you want a large screen and color display you will have to move up to a tablet but be aware that kindle reading is extremely hard on the battery life of a tabletone of my favorite features is that this particular kindle is the cheapest because it has no backlight this is considered a negative by some people but i find that hours of staring into a backlit screen causes eyestrain this inexpensive kindle is the easiest for me to read and i wish people could realize what constant backlit screen time does to ones eyesi dont think kindle will ever completely replace print books i still have a small collection of my favorites in high quality hardbound editions but for general reading this is an awesome compliment to my print collection

Review: full disclosure i previously owned a kindle fire hd that died very suddenly and inexplicably after 2 years of gentle use so my opinions on the kindle touch is after having owned a fancier model of kindleover all this is a good little ereader it does the job its small enough for me to hold operate one handed and i have smallmedium sized lady hands the font adjustment options make it easy to find something readable for your own eyes and the paperwhite screen is wonderful its so nice to be able to read outside on a sunny day without glare making it impossible to see the words i love how light this little thing is how portable and how easy straight forward to usemy biggest complaint is with the lag in doing well anything pages do not seamlessly turn it takes a second or two to utilize the xray or dictionary features etc its not a deal breaker but having come from the kindle fire hd its definitely something that i notice and am mildly irritated by also i sort of hate that its only black white buying books and seeing the fullcolour covers in my library is something that i missin general this is just a much more basic reading experience than what i experienced with the fire hd however that is to be expected as the price is essentially 13 of what the fire hd cost some trade off is to be expected i suppose i will say that having a more inexpensive ereader though lacking in some bells whistles that i had grown accustomed to is nice because i feel less worried about being careful with it and babying it there is a bit more freedom to be found with a device that doesnt cost hundreds of dollarsover all i would recommend this ereader to someone who really just needs a basic ereader that they can take on the bus traveling etc its portable its readable and it very much does the job however if having something fancy shiny is important to you you may want to consider one of the fire series readers
