Review: i am addicted to my kindle i love having a home library filled with physical books at my fingertips whenever im researching however having a kindle is wonderful for reading novels i never got to read many novels because much of my life has been spent in the textbooks with the kindle i am able to pick a textbook or novel out and read it without having to hold up a book and manage the pages and keep it from being at a bad angle i still prefer physical books for researching but maybe there is an adjustment period for me the kindle is always at a good angle is light weight and the screen is great on my eyes i have had an astigmatism for most of my life and reading has always caused headaches so enjoying reading is something i never experienced until having the kindle i got this kindle as a test to see if it would be a good gift for my daughter for christmas and we also purchased the paperwhite to see the difference i myself like the basic kindle better than the paperwhite because of the balance to its weight overall and the screen however i decided that i would give my daughter the paperwhite for christmas this year since she can read things with the light whereas i have a difficulty with lights my daughter likes to read in bed at night with just a night light and the paperwhite will be perfect for that she was upset when i told her we could only keep one and the paperwhite had to go back i really just wrapped it to give it to her after we decided she would enjoy itafter purchasing two kindles we ended up getting a third one for my mother who loves it as well

Review: even with the most basic model amazon still makes a worthwhile ereader granted i bought kindle fire hd 6 to be shared with the family its been passed around so much that by the time it get passed along to me i dont have much time to read i knew it was going to happen eventually so when it sooner than i expected i settled on a refurbished kindle touch in this case settling turnout to be one the best decisions i made in whilethe refurbished kindle touch is almost indistinguishable from its new predecessors except sometime during lifetime it was returned to amazon for some reason the device itself the most basic of ereader offered by amazon primarily to get you to buy ebooks from their online store but can also be used read ebooks borrowed from public libraries and carry around compatible personal documents pending you dont mind the monochrome presentation resembling a small tablet computer in alot of respects it is an ereader distinguishes itself from tablets with a monochrome electronic ink screen that does not refresh itself like other lcd screens and has a lower power consumption rate that can make the battery last for days weeks between recharges this is a dedicated ereader there are no apps that can be installed and no speaker or headphone jack to listen to mp3s or audiobooks perhaps more importantly this model is not a paperwhite and you must have your external light source to read in lowlight situationsas good as it is there is one major fault that i discovered the hard way while amazon elaborates in alot of official documentation about personal documents and cloud storage a rather perverse semantics come into play access to the cloud library is not the same as amazons cloud drive in other words if you have personal files stored on amazons cloud drive they will not be accessible from this version of the kindle in order to read your personal documents from the kindle you must either send them via email or copy them via usb as a corollary by plugging in this kindle to your computer its identified as mass storage device so managing it is not much different from a usb flash driveif you can keep the above in mind i think you can really make for you i bought the refurbished kindle primarily to save every cent i could and what i get out of it more than makes up for its limits you can buy inexpensive generic clipon spotlight for lowlight reading and if all you do to read the kindle is more than suited to the task with the durability and ease of use you can only get at these prices in addition to buying kindle i would recommend buying foliotype cover and screen protector to further increase the longevity of your kindle

Review: i bought my mother a kindle but i resisted buying one for myself for a long time because i like to read ebooks on my iphone or ipad however amazon offered a deal for prime members which made this kindle only 50 i thought it over and decided for that price it would be nice to be able to read in direct sunlight and not have to worry about running down my battery after a couple of hours of reading as it does on my iphone the kindle i had bought for my mom was one with a keyboard and side clickbuttons i wasnt that keen on having that type of awkward navigation but this particular model is a touch kindle when it arrived i was very pleasantly surprised that it wasnt too different from using my iphone for navigation in that you touch the screen to do this or that i did have to go look at some tutorials online to get the hang of it but it is fairly simple to use now that i know where to touch the screen for the home page or forward and back pages i like the size and weight it is about like reading a paperback book maybe even a little lighter i can almost hold it in one hand and use a finger to turn the pages on the same hand although it isnt as easy as with the iphone for thatthere are only a couple of things that i find annoying the onoff button is on the bottom edge of the frame i tend to hold a book or kindle on the sides or bottom and i have accidentally turned it off while reading because my finger touched the onoff button the onoff button would be better if it was at the top rather than the bottom the other thing is that i cant seem to bookmark more than one page at a time i am in the middle of a project of converting to ebooks more than 50 stories and novels from a series that is long out of print these stories have been scanned and turned into editable text and proofed mostly on my computer but i still find typos while reading on the kindle i want to be able to put a bookmark on each page that i find a typo on so i can go to my computer later and fix them all at one time i think i am supposed to be able to bookmark more than one page but these ebooks i have converted myself dont seem to let me do that if anyone knows what i am doing wrong there let me know
Title: it is great for reading outside in the hammock

Review: it is perfect for what it isan e reader sharp clear adjustable fonts easy to use and featherweight light with this device you can have a large number of books at your fingertips what every purchaser should know is that this is not a tablet and amazon has never marketed or promoted it as one this is a generation 7 kindle it is not a backlit display so you will have to read it in a place with adequate ambient light just like reading a book or buy a little clip on reading lamp if you are looking for the backlit version you need to buy the kindle paperwhite buying new books from the amazon store is a snap once you have your account set up i had an existing account so i simply had to log in it is also possible to download kindle format ebooks through your local library limit 5 at a time through overdrivecom but you must have a library card and set up a password of your choosing finding and downloading books from the kindle is not the way to go it is possible but the kindle browser is slow and difficult to read it is far easier to connect the kindle to your pc and download the kindle ebook through overdrive overdrive sends it to your amazon account online you just go to your amazon bookshelf online and download through your pc to the kindle i bought mine through amazon on sale for 4999 with my amazon credit visa accrued points i ended up coming out of pocket about 2000 i couldnt be happier so far i hope you will find this review helpful

Title: i loved the original kindle

Review: i bought this kindle for 2 reasons 1 it was on sale for 29 and 2 the size you can’t beat the price and it was a real steal for 29 i own the original kindle with the keyboard and a kindle fire and absolutely love this one as a backup for days when i want something portable and lightweight for reading onlyi agree with other posters that this kindle is not for you if you want the following a light external buttons or anything other than a reading device this device does not have a light i bought mine with the clear understanding that if i wanted a light i would have to buy a kindle paperwhite so please don’t be confused personally it has a better display than my original kindle with the keyboard which looked almost gray and not as bright as this one it is pleasant to use this kindle in regular light and there is no glare the display is crisp and cleanthere are no external buttons except the power button and everything else is touch screen which is what i like my only comment is the fact that sometimes there is a tiny microsecond of lag when turning pages but nothing to get upset about for the price i paid i’m not complainingfinally the thing i like most about this handy little device is the size and portability i positioned it next to my iphone 6 and it is a few inches larger in both directions but not much the display is generous and it feels good in my hands while holding it i did purchase a case since i didn’t want it to get scratched up but overall well worth the money i find myself going for this one before the kindle fire when i don’t want to carry the extra weight in my pursealso and i think this goes back to comments from when the kindle was first released the device comes with a microusb charging cable but not a wall plug but if you’re like me you’ve got 2 or 3 wall plugs already from other devices so no worries there either

Title: awesome

Review: i started with the kindle fire and got this second its much nicer reading books on this unitit is lighter youll irritate your handswrist holding the fire steady for hours at a timeit doesnt overhead the fire overheats if you use it for graphics heavy stuff if you put it in a case so it stays propped up you can overheat until the unit shuts downits smaller than the fire easier for me to grab the unit much lower risk of dropping itits got a glare free screen read outdoors in daylight again read at night with a reading light the traditional wayno blue light in your eyes at night i confess it was affecting me and i refused to believe i was getting insomnia until i switchedless distracting the browser is bw and awkward to use there are no apps finally finish reading those bookspage speed is good paging backward is touchyyou touch the top of the screen to call up the controls this is good its less awkward than the fire where you touched the middlereasonable selection of fonts and sizeswish listthe black print on gray background isnt high contrast the better the light the easier to read i wish id ordered a paperwhite or i had a decent reading lightbattery life unlike the fire this battery really hangs onto its charge if unused its fine on its own for a week under heavy use 6 hoursday you will want to recharge every third day just long enough to forget to charge you cant read and charge if the battery is completely drainedthe width of the plastic edge next to the screen is just wide enough to make touching the screen for the page turn a bit of a hop for your fingerthe library is presented as a list which you can sort by title author recent etc this isnt all that helpful the larger your collection the more you need the book cover to help your memory you need to open the book to see the cover a thumbnail would be so usefulthe kindle doesnt always break lines at the most aesthetically pleasing breakpoint you may be left with half the line empty while the rest of the page is filled this is obvious at the larger fontsthe usb cord used for recharging is pretty short it is difficult to reach most outlets while reading charging from a computer is slowi recommend calibre shareware if you want to read files on your device calibre will convert the file to kindlecompatible format and load it onto the machineso much lighter and less distracting than the fire ive left the fire at home for a month now and i dont miss itlets face it i use the fire for playing games now

Review: im not a huge fan of touchscreen devices though this one has its pluses and minuseson the positive side its easy to put items into collections i wish i could dragdrop items but being able to click check boxes and easily type is a positive the ability to select different font types and sizes is nice and you can easily add bookmarks my kindle just updated within the past few days and added the bookerly font which is amazons font specifically designed for kindle its nice but i prefer palatino out of the options available so i stuck with what i already liked the price is good and it can hold a lot of books the screen is also easy to read even outside in bright lighton the negative side the touchscreen is really sensitive if i bump the kindle all of the sudden my font is huge and then i have to make it smaller again or ill find myself on another page i appreciate the ease on turning pages but constantly having to readjust my font every time my cat decides to bump the kindle or if i put it facedown on my lap for a moment is really frustrating there also isnt a built in light on this model so you need to get a booklight or make sure that you have adequate light to read withoverall its a good kindle but i miss my buttons i just couldnt afford the version of the kindle that actually has buttons now
Title: a good kindle even though i hate touchscreens

Review: this is my first kindle although i have had computers since the mid80s as well as ipods and iphones i always liked to read books with real paper i liked the feel of them to look back at earlier passages at times in short to read real books not online books however i have accumulated too many books and ive run out of space i even developed an allergy to old book dust so my dilemma was this i joined a book club and we read some very interesting books but the last thing i need is more books given all that i decided to try kindle the glarefree screen seemed like a good idea since my eyes get tired from too much time on the computer and i particularly liked not having to charge yet another device daily so the two week battery life time sounded promising both of these features were a good idea and the price wasnt bad eitherupdate some pros and cons that werent initially apparent the screen is a little darker than i had expected not as bright as a new paperback but still is very readable free books werent as available as i had hoped i signed up for kindle unlimited but found that none of the book club books were on it i then got a library card and discovered downloads the first book was found and i thoroughly enjoyed reading it on kindle it made it easy to read just a bit at a time if i didnt have much time kindle plus an amazon recommended cover were a bit heavy to hold up in bed which sometimes affected my wristfingers but i still found it interesting to read in this way the next book however was much more difficult to access it was not on kindle unlimited or the lending library and although it was in my home library as a download this kind of kindle cant read the download only kindle fire can read it an amazon issue that i wish they would resolve i finally went through a lot of trouble and registered for a 3m cloud account and was able to download the book to my desktop computer same issue with kindle fire being ok but not this kindle but thats no way to read a book if i had owned an ipad that would have worked but for now my kindle is idle to be continued
Title: i mostly like it but im not abandoning books yet

Review: i had an older kindle with a keypad and buttons and i was curious to try out a newer model i figured that one could go with me on trips and the other could stay at homethe new charging cord is an annoyance i much prefer the old white long kindle cord i could charge the kindle while reading in bed not so with the much shorter black cord its not a big deal but an annoyancethis kindle works fine and does what it says i dont see much of a difference from my keyboard version the page turning is pretty handy although it took a while to make it work all the time thats not a kindle problem thats my problemone thing that i find very very annoying is the incredible sensitivity of the screen i have had kleenex tissue hit the screen and change the page or more usually change the fonts ive fallen asleep while reading and the kindle hitting the mattress or a blanket hitting the page will bring up a dictionary or change the fonts or activate something im used to this behavior but it is pretty annoyingthe only other problem i had was getting my books installed on the kindle from the amazon cloud on the old kindle everything was sorted into collections but when i attempted to bring things down on the new kindle it was all messed up and confused this is probably the most serious issue i ran into but some patient work has things sorted out

Review: as an avid lifelong reader of books i wasn’t sure i’d like the kindle and was unwilling to invest much i bought this one during the black friday sale for 4999 a price that finally convinced me to try it what i like the light weight and compact size are perfect and it fits easily into a pocket of my handbag for travel pageturning is simple and the screen is very easy on the eyes in decent lighting as a senior i love love love being able to adjust the font size the charge lasts a long time and it recharges quickly using my computer’s usb port buying books on amazon is very easywhat i’m still getting used to the edges around the screen are narrow except at the bottom and i haven’t yet found a way to hold the kindle comfortably for long periods i’ve come close to dropping it several times especially if i doze off while reading it would be nice to have a stretchy fabric strap on the back to slip my hand through i’m not used to touch screens don’t care for them and the kindle’s is very sensitive so i tend to accidentally activate features i don’t want enter multiples of letters while searching or send myself to mysterious locations in the book and have to find my way back i don’t use social media or other sharing features all i do is buy and read so all in all it’s an excellent value for a new user four stars instead of five is because of the toosensitive touch screen

Title: too new for my opinion yet

Review: i love my kindle i bought one when the price dropped below 100 back in 2011 a touch screen sounded nice but physical buttons were ok by me at 79 the new touch screen kindle was definitely tempting but i resisted until thanksgiving when the price dropped to 49 two days later i had my new kindle my husband had my old one hes been a read paper books or read on the tablet or phone kind of guy two weeks later when the price dropped to 59 i asked him if he wanted santa to get him one after comparing the 2 he said yes so why this kindledesigned for readersphysical books have dark print on a light background they dont have built in lights you sit in a spot with adequate lighting and read them the same is true of this kindle of course sometimes it would be nice to be able to read in the dark or see the color in a book fortunately kindle apps are available for almost any device and amazon syncs across my devices that means i can switch to using my tablet or phone when i need color or a light for the record i dont do that very oftenease of usei really didnt mind the physical buttons on my old kindle i also dont miss them its so much easier to hold the kindle when i dont have to position my thumb on the edge of the device so i can turn the page on the relatively rare occasions when i need to type something the keyboard on the new kindle is incredibly easy to use typing on the old one was a pain in the butt getting a definition or highlighting a passage is a matter of touching the screen not repeatedly pushing a buttonadjustable fontsneed reading glasses i do sure i can read normal sized print in physical books but my kindle lets me adjust the font size to make reading easier this isnt a new feature but its easier than it used to bebattery lifethe bad news is i dont get the projected month on a charge the good news is the battery lasts days not hours amazon bases their claim on 12 hour of reading per day 15 hours per monthand leaving wifi off i spend an hour or 2 a day reading so that cuts the estimated battery life at least in half the kindle uses battery only for page turns and accessing wifi i leave wifi on i also use a larger font and i read more than 1000 wpm google says the average person reads 250300 wpm the font size and reading speed mean at least 4 times the estimated page turns battery life may not be what amazon claims but its certainly within expected parameters and it definitely beats battery life on my phone and tabletgood readsi havet previously used good reads but i do now i love that its integrated into this kindlefamily librarythis wasnt available on the old kindle i like sharing books with my husband we dont have any children in residence but the family features sound greatbuying experiencebooks dont have to cost money i usually dont go into a bookstore or a library in search of a specific book i go to a section and choose from whats available i do the same on amazon i do most of my browsing in the free best sellers list since free books dont necessarily stay free i buy whatever looks like id like it i dont always like them andor read them but i have more than 800 purchased books most of them free and all i have to take with me on the plane is my kindle of course at the bookstore i can sample the book before i buy it amazon lets me download a free sample once i buy a book amazon downloads it to my kindle in about the time it takes to read this sentence amazingother book sourcespublic libraries the selection of ebooks at my library is significantly smaller than the selection of paper books no ebooks dont cost the library nothing they are actually significantly more expensive that said the selection has definitely improved books check out for 13 weeks the process is ridiculously easy check out the book select kindle overdrive takes you to amazon where the buy button has been changed to the borrow button dont count on finishing the last chapter after lending period ends the book will stop functioning the second the lending period ends the good part of that is that there are no fines for late returnsprime lending library check out 1 qualifying book per month with no due date i have a wishlist of prime books i want to read i checked the library for them most werent availableso my free sources dont overlap this is a nice perk of prime but definitely not a reason to sign up prime books are only available on kindle devices not kindle appskindle unlimited for 999month i didnt expect to like my free trial but i did i could easily find and read more than 10 worth of books per month most all of my prime wishlist is available on kindle unlimited while i like kindle unlimited i have suspended my subscription for the moment i will probably renew periodically my husband wasnt impressed with the selection i browse bookstores he shops for a specific book kindle unlimited is more suited to browsingspecial offersas previously implied im cheap that said i did wonder about the special offers buy the kindle with so pay the 20 difference later if they bother you you will see them as a screen saver and at the bottom 12 inch of the home page you do not see them when you are actually reading i dont spend much time on the home screen i spend even less time looking at the screensaver i spend most of my time on the kindle actually reading some deals arent bad so i occasionally look at the list in the menu its definitely not worth 20 to me to get rid of them

Review: my one star review is solely based on amazons decision to include special offers on their lower priced kindle touch which is still actually not super cheap typically running you about 80 my husband purchased the kindle touch for me from a retailer and so it automatically included what amazon refers to as special offers that amazon claims only kindle users are privy to at first the special offers were limited to amazon products only amazon fire tv stick chargers cases etc and although i was pretty disappointed to learn that my screenlock pages consisted of basically a rotation of amazon ads it was somewhat tolerable although i should note that these special offers were not special at all as the price of each item displayed was actually the same exact price if not cheaper on amazons main website which everyone has access to occasionally amazon would throw a few book cover illustrations in the rotation which was a nicer display although it still displayed the price of the book so was technically an ad as far as im concernedthen it took a turn for the worst a few weeks later my kindle updated automatically and with the update the ads became completely out of control it was no longer limited to amazon products but instead included ads from asics shoes quaker oatmeal vitamin pills icecream life alert bracelets and even blood pressure monitoring devices and it was return policy instead i took the route that i know amazon hopes each person that buys the discounted kindles will take i bought my way out of them for an additional 20 and no you cannot use an amazon gift card to pay for the ads to be removed from your kindle as an amazon customer service person formally informed me fortunately my kindle was purchased at a black friday special price saving us about 30 total and making this 20 adremoval fee a little easier to swallowthat being said as soon as i paid the fee the ads immediately disappeared from my kindle touch and i am much happier with it Review: this review is for the 7th generation kindle 6 first of all let me start by saying it is very important to know what you want to do with your kindle before purchasing one know what you are buying this is a very basic kindlewhat it is not it does not come with a light it does not use 3g or 4g and does not have the capability it does not allow a user to browse the internet it does not allow a used to play games it does not show colorwhat it is it is very lightweight it uses wifi to download books it uses eink to display titles words etc it has a touch screen that is very clearly laid out it is very easy to use without all the clutter of apps that comes with kindles that do have internet access it has extra options on the screen such as a dictionary sync to furthest page read note pages etc it has a long battery lifelet me explain why my nots do not matter to me i never read in a dimly lit area or in the dark so i did not care about having a light although if allowed to pick one feature to change i would probably ask for a light however i do not find it necessary to have one with this product a person must have wifi access to download books which is fine for me since i have wifi at home i download all my books at home so that i will have plenty to read before leaving on a trip if you want to download books anytimeanywhere this is not the product for you if you are wanting to play music games tune in to social media surf the internet etc this is not the right kindle for you i use my laptop and smartphone for all the above but did not want this on my kindlenow let me tell you why i love this kindle this is so lightweight that i feel like i am almost holding nothing even after i put it in a case i love the fact that it uses eink instead of a backlit screen because my eyes are sometimes a bit sensitive and eyes grow tired if using my daughters kindle fire to read with the eink i can read for a longer time i really like the touch screen and do not understand the negative comments about not having page turners the page can either be swiped to the side to change or the bottom righthand corner can be tapped to change to the next page when the top is tapped a menu to go to the home screen amazon shopping cart search bar font and extra options is displayed which is so easy to use i do enjoy the extra options menu because it has just enough extra features without being too many like the clutter of apps i mentioned in the above section please understand i enjoy using apps and like them on my smartphone just not my kindleif you are wanting a kindle that will do everything a computer or tablet will do then i recommend purchasing another type of kindle to meet all your needs but if you are just wanting to read books electronically without other stuff to get you sidetracked then this quite possibly could be the kindle for youi love reading books and having the ability to finish a book then download another one immediately as well as storing my previously read books i also really like being able to look up the meaning of words found in my book from a dictionary right at my fingertips and never stop reading my kindle is reserved for reading pure and simple and i am loving using ithope this helps

Review: the kindle holds the lions share of ebook capital and i decided to switch to ebooks about a month ago i chose this kindle because it was on sale for black friday i love the convenience of the ebooks but im slightly disappointed with the actual devicefor what you pay here you get the bare bones plus the pleasure of viewing ads when youre not in the middle of a book its fine by me because you only need the ui really when selecting a new book to read which happens about once or twice a week for me amounting to about ten minutes a month with a little book or shoe ad wedged in the bottom corner the touchscreen which i thought would annoy me is actually very nice and i have seen no need for physical buttons to tun pagesthe kindle is a great ecosystem lots of books at fair prices and plenty of distribution options but it gets 3 stars from me due to its shortcomings regarding the hardware no this device doesnt come with a light but thats clearly marked so i knew i wasnt going to get the light however i think its silly to pay an extra 50 or so for the paperwhite the model above this that is backlit for what amounts to a cheap weak flashlight i know there are other benefits higher pixel density maybe its a little lighter but those changes shouldnt cost so much moreone other thing to note this device is a little heavier than i thought it would be its not uncomfortable by any means but its worth noting here its also a little slippery i would suggest buying a case for it amazon has a lot of cases available for 10

to think it has a light when it clearly states that it doesnt if you want a light get a paperwhite theyre great toothis simple little kindle was a deal crazy sale that i couldnt pass up as i knew id need a replacement for my keyboard model anyway i also need something to slip into my bag so i can read while im waiting or sitting in a coffee shop or commutingscreen size about the same on all three models this makes sense but i decided to mention itresolution the resolution is better than that of the kindle keyboard again this makes sense since its a later model of kindle and almost as good as the paperwhitecolorbrightness this isnt a tablet so there wouldnt be any color ive seen it mentioned in other reviews which is why i mention it here the screen appears as bright as the kindle keyboard that is it looks like the page of an open book it is not as bright as the paperwhite so there is not as great a contrast this isnt a complaint though since the paperwhite is always lit when i compared i had the light setting down as low as it could go and by nature will always be brighterpage turn i miss my buttons but the touch screen is nice as well the kindle 6 that im reviewing here seems to have a very sensitive touchscreen as compared with the paperwhite this means that if you brush against it it might go forward or back a page or two i fixed this by getting a cover and closing it when im not immediately reading really thats all it tookspeed i had no issues it was quite quick to load whatever i wantedcollections you can import your collections from your cloud though youll have to download each book individually this was actually a good thing since im realizing i dont need all of my books on my device all the time heh maybe that has something to do with how fast this thing isend grade 45 stars rounded up im biased though i just really love the kindle and im still amazed at how many free books there areadded if any issues come up ill amend this review

Review: i am in love with this kindle i will be honest after having issues with my first kindle i believe it was the 2nd generation and then the kindle fire i vowed that i would never buy another kindle device again instead i would just use the free kindle app on my android tablet or phone that was before i started having migraines nearly everyday reading on a backlit screen such as my laptop phone or tablet made these migraines worse being an avid reader i decided to give the kindle another trythe size and weight of this kindle is perfect its comfortable for both one handed and two handed reading i have arthritis in my hands so this was really important the text is crisp and clear it is so much easier to read than on a tablet or other similar device it really feels like im reading a real book instead of a digital book the battery life is amazing i binge read 4 rather long books took me about a week and that battery lasted the whole time with lighter reading the battery lasts much longer its over a week since i last charged it and its only at about 75 my first kindle did not have the touchscreen feature and i must admit i love iti did try the web browsing but honestly if you want to web browse use a different device this device is made for reading books it excels at that if you are buying it for the option to browse the internet there are plenty of other devices that do that i suppose the only feature that would be nice on it would maybe be texttospeech but its not really missed it would be easier to listen to audio books on my phone anyway as that is a smaller device and can just sit in my pocketif you want an excellent ereader you cant beat this one especially given that the kindle store probably contains the most free and discounted books in the market

to buy the newest model the price was 7900 i only spent 4900 on my first kindle i then realized that i could trade in my old kindle and get a gift card i then saw the touchscreen kindle was being offered for 4900 on black friday i could not pass this up i got my new kindle last week and i love itthe touchscreen did take a little bit of getting used to after a day of use i found i liked the touch screen better than the page turn buttons i found highlighting to be a lot easier this kindle actually highlights the passage instead of underlinei love the new features on the touch screen kindle i love having goodreads right there on the menu i use goodreads all the time and it is much easier to update what books i am reading i really love the page flip feature so that i can go anywhere in the book and not have to constantly turn the page and lose my place the new about this book feature is great since you can mark the book currently reading on goodreads it also tells you if the book is part of a series xray this book is a good feature because you can go to the dictionary and wikipedia without leaving the book the touch keyboard is a lot easier to use than the old kindle writing notes is a lot easieri had very few problems with the touch screen kindle the main problem was getting all my books transferred onto it i had some books on my old kindle that i transferred with a usb cable so they were not on the cloud i could not open the books so i ended up having to rebuy two books the cloud and the device sections took some getting used to i have a lot of books i borrow from the library and they show up on the cloud some books have the loan ended so i had to make an archive collectioni wish the touch screen kindle had more font choices on the old kindle you had a lot more choices i like times new roman san serif i like the plainness of iti am very satisfied with my touch screen kindle for now i might in the future trade it in for a kindle fire

Review: i cant give this neat little device 5 stars i just cant do it it works good enough to do the job but im not blown away i really expected the screen to be more white not so offwhite but it is still very readable in good lighting which is what it is designed for i probably would have wanted the paperwhite model but i really liked the discounted price on prime day so i can live with it the touch screen seems overly sensitive to me and i frequently turn multiple pages by accident and have to find my way back i may have to try a stylus it also seems slow and laggy to respond for everything but page turns once again i bought the cheapest one so i can live with it other than those little issues its a really nice little reader and does everything automatically like downloading and such i like it but not 5 stars worth

Review: i was much happier with the previous versioni like the touchscreen in theory but this one is not great the font and text size change every time i put it down very irritating it needs a lock of some sort i wish you could set your own gestures the ones it uses are strange and awkward i have to use both hands to turn a page thats sillyi can choose to read in landscape orientation but only on one side id much prefer the other one and it switches back to portrait when you go to the menu and other areas i find it harder to hold in portrait as it becomes top heavy i really hate that hate itim a bit of a wordy i like reading the dictionary i was really looking forward to the word wise and vocabulary builder feature but found it to be something for children or for people who are still learning the language the first time i actually came across a word i needed a definition for it didnt have one that feature ought to have difficulty settingsi dont hate it but im really disappointed in itit absolutely does everything it says it does but not as well as it should

Review: i had one of the old second generation kindles with the keyboard that communicated through the sprint network loved it but then i decided to move up in the world to a tablet specifically a galaxy tab 2 101 and passed the kindle on to my son again i loved the tablet but portability was an issue it was too big to take with me to the store while waiting for my wife whose i just need a couple of things usually means hours so last month when the price came down dramatically i decided to splurge on this entrylevel kindle just for reading purposes i absolutely love it no it cant do all the things my tablet can do but then again neither can my tablet when it doesnt have a wifi connection its small light and easy to carry in my pocket as far as the touch screen that many are complaining about i have no issue with it given that i had to swipe to read on my tablet while travelling for christmas i loved the noglare screen for reading in the car and after dealing with the battery hog that a tablet can be i cant stress enough how much i love the multiple day battery great choice for reading

Title: good product missed a huge savings opportunity updated

Review: i had some problems with this kindle as described on my previous review copied bellow but the excellent amazon customer service promptly contacted me and proposed me a solution which was updating the kindle software or replacing the device as last resource i have been using this kindle for a few days after the update and now it works like a charm i am giving 4 starts to this kindle and 6 stars for the excellent customer serviceif you dont care about having an integrated service with goodreads i would still recommend the previous kindle 4th generation because is thinner lighter and aesthetically more beautiful nevertheless being able to access goodreads on your kindle is perfect and if you care about that i would definitely recommend this kindle 6 touchscreeni was reluctant to upgrade my old kindle because it worked great for me however the integration with goodreads was something that i wanted and since it is unlikely that amazon will release a firmware upgrade for old kindles i decided to give this new model a chance i have to say that i am frustrated with my decision and i still read most of my ebook on my good old kindlecons sometimes the touch screen stays active for few seconds even after kindle is put to sleep because of that my books are frequently in different pages when i turn back on and it is a pain to find back the right page when i am reading in the airplane mode to save some battery errors appears in the middle of the reading saying that it couldnt find network connection i have to turn some pages back and forth to make the message disappear and when it does sometimes it skips randomly a few pages or a whole chapter and it is again a pain to find back the right page the touch screen was not designed for left handed people the software that runs on this kindle feels like horriblepros integrated with goodreadsthe previous kindle fourth generation is simpler but very well designed this new one sounds cool in theory but they Review: the kindle touch 7th gen2014 is my first ereader ever ive been thinking of getting one for a while since reading off a tablet or even a lcd screen anything backlit is very fatiguing on the eyes my eyes feel extremely tired and dry after any such reading session another big reason for my purchase is two books that i wanted to buy were about 25 each while the kindle versions were 10 a great incentive to finally take the plunge right there was a savings of 30 its the same for other books with varying degrees of costsavingon to this one i considered either this or the paperwhite and eventually went with the touch to save the 40 upon opening the box and slipping the kindle out of its plastic case i wanted to remove the sticker stuck across the screen but lo and behold it was the actual screen amazing the text on this reader looks exactly like a printed page actually better specifications say that the paperwhite is a higher resolution but let me tell you i cannot imagine text being any more crisp than this at least i doubt that the human eye can really differentiate itits a real plus to be able to set the text size to what you desire i imagine this is a big plus to older people who are getting in the reading glasses zone the only thing i would say is that the software could be a bit better in this regard the text size selection should stay with the book rather than be a system wide selection right now if i change the font size it does it for all books and for some reason different books have different default sizes in general the operating system is good but i imagine it can get a lot better one thing that is good is the ability to set up the kindle for other users ie freetime you can set up a freetime account another user on your kindle and only add selected books to their library that way you an keep more adult oriented books away from kids for instancethis kindle requires light to read but thats not an issue for me its just like a book you need a light to read so im either in a lit room or use my bedside lampive had mine for about 10 days now and the battery is still at least 30 charged in these 10 days i have discovered a ton of free kindle books from racy novels to biographies to classics to a magic book its really drawing me back in to reading its amazing to be able to have hundreds of books right in your hands theres no doubt that printing of books will be gone within the next generation and with this wonderful device screen technology i wont miss themin summary i would say that if the extra 40 is no problem spring for the paperwhite as having the lit screen different from backlit screens could be useful when reading in bed with someone else allinall i have to say that this is easier on my eyes than any screen or even a regular book and it is getting me back to the joys of reading its been a great purchase for me
Title: my first ereader and it is awesome

Review: i bought this the package arrived timely and in good condition this review does not reflect negatively on midcontinent whom i have bought from before and look forward to purchasing through again this review is about the productkindle ereader when the kindle arrived i discovered the usb cable was insufficient to properly charge the kindle per information supplied by kindle  so i purchased ac adapter for additional 2000 then discovered after charging the kindle battery and reviewing the eoperators manual i had to have wifi to link to computer i dont have wifi so i purchased a netgear 23 usb wifi usb adapter for 3000 to create linkage between my computer and the kindle supposedly cannot use the cable supplied with kindle to download then spent 3 hours on amazon tech support and 65 hours trying to register kindle that according to amazon was already registered because i am a customer but the kindle doesnt know that the wifi netgear23 connection is listed on the wifi networks the kindle can identify but will not recognize any passwords to allow me to complete the registration process and enable use of the kindle there is a workaround i can use the enclosed cable and the cloud which i have never used and if i download one book the cost to use the cloud is 500 thats the monthly minimum chargesupposedly the more i use the cloud the less the pro rata charge up to a volume level of data whereat the charges increase for my nook there is no cost no cloud involved getting a kindle up and running should not be this hard or costly to do the additional costs are not transparent to the purchaser the kindle does not appear to have a way to back out of the registration process once one is into it to change passwords user ids nor confirm same yesterday the amazon tech spent 3 hours and we couldnt solve the problem today i called back and the amazon tech was in a noisy boiler room and could not hear me could not make her computer work and being located oconus was having as many problems understanding my english as i was having understanding hers she seemed like a nice person but we didnt talk long i have a nook i have used it for years i wanted the kindle to download ebooks that are not otherwise available i am frustrated unhappy and not a happy camperbut the world as i know it will go on no i cannot get through or out of the registration loop on the Review: i recently purchased this kindle with the intention of testing it out and returning it if it didnt meet my expectations after using it for over a month however its definitely become a keeperone of the first things i noticed was how much faster it was compared to my previously owned kindle keyboard im talking about both the speediness of the device itself and overall usability typing text and selecting things both feel faster on the touchscreen interface than using the kindle keyboards physical keys in addition because everything is done through the screen i can usually touch the spot where i want to move the cursor instead of having to scroll to the location the pages turn noticeably more quickly on this model than the kindle keyboard i had another thing i like is the feel of the device this kindle is a little thicker than its keyboard predecessor but its also shorter meaning holding it is even more similar to holding a small paperback book this combined with the nicely sized touchscreen and some of the touch gestures makes onehanded navigation even easier my only criticism is that the screen sometimes seems a little more sensitive than expected causing unintentional page turns this doesnt occur very frequently however and may be more due to me still getting used to the change in interacting with the device regardless this can be alleviated by using a stylus and the screen overall is well calibrated in my experienceas for the new features like vocabulary builder and integration with goodreads i dont currently use those much however i can see how theyd be useful especially in the case of studying and trying to get through difficult material or if you had kids and wanted to encourage them to read more without having to buy a separate device and if you never end up needing them it isnt ridiculously hard to either ignore them or turn them off in the system settingsoverall this was a very good purchase compared to the kindle keyboard this model is faster and more comfortable to use the extra features dont weigh it down and the new design makes the reader less aware of the hardware and more aware of whats being read

Review: i recently purchased the amazon kindle with a 6” touchscreen and wifi capabilities i would highly recommend this product to anyone who is a book lover or traveler there are several features of the kindle that i enjoy the glarefree screen quick download times battery life and tools available while readingthe kindle’s glarefree screen is great for reading outside on sunny days unlike the ipad you don’t need to worry about a glare coming off the screen making it hard to read however should you want to used an ipad all of your books are available using the kindle app reading from the tablet instead of a book is also nice to have for beach reading there is nothing worse than a book full of sandi was shocked when my books downloaded so fast they downloaded just as quickly any app would download on your phone i found this very impressive considering how many gbs of space is used to download books to a device the quick download speed really comes in handy if you are at an airport and want to buy a book before a flight keep in mind the kindle has wifi access not 3g this means you must be in a location with wifi to purchase and download booksnothing is more frustrating than needing to constantly be charging your electronic devices you should be able to go a few days without needing to charge your kindle this depends of course on how much you use it during the day when you travel you may need to charge it more frequently than when you do not because you will be reading on it more this is one of my favorite features as i find myself charging my iphone and ipad at least once a day even when i’m not using them much throughout the dayfinally there are some very helpful tools that can be used while reading i find the dictionary to be very useful whenever you come across a word that you do not know you can highlight it and look it up right then along with this there is a highlighting tool you can highlight passages in the book you are reading and what other readers highlighted as welli give this product 5 stars and i hope my fellow book lovers find this product as great as i do

Review: my rating is heavily influenced by my expectation that this would be a step up from my kindle keyboard which died at 5 years of age the new kindle is not as comfortable in the hand i just dont love the touch screen and it is only for reading i actually find the touch screen kind of annoying personal preference also on the negative side and a warning to other buyers if you enjoy active content you wont be able to use it on this device i played every word pretty much every day on my kindle keyboard received a paperwhite as a gift and discovered active content is not compatible after a lengthy phone call and being assured by an amazon kindle expert that i could play the game on this model i exchanged the paperwhite active content is not compatible with this model i dont know why their expert assured me it was its another annoyance and it seems kind of stupid that amazon would take away the ability to use their own material the only way you can use active content now is on certain kindle models only available through thirdparty sellers on the plus side the screen is easy to read for anyone who has eye issues with backlit devices this is a nice nonglare reading experience there are different fonts and sizes to choose from this is the first time i have been so seriously disappointed with a buying experience from amazon and its really left a bad impression the paperwhite was given as a thoughtful gift to replace my beloved keyboard however the gift giver wanted me to be able to play my game and read so encouraged me to call to arrange an exchange for one that would do what i wanted i made the decision to replace it with this model on the advice of an expert who apparently wasnt i was disappointed again so all in all if you only want to read and cant take led or backlit screens this is an ok tool for those purposes as a ps why was the keyboard eliminated some people liked it repair services would have been a great option also im sure there are others out there who dont feel the newer models are all an improvement

on on a bad day it will not connect at all such as the case while im writing this initially ive purchased 2 of the basic kindles for valentines day for me and my wife the wifi problems started with both devices on the first day ive called customer service and was advised to update the software i did the update but that didnt help much as both devices were with onoff relationship with my home network from there ive spent countless hours on the phone during the next couple of days with customer service training to fix the problem the last time ive spoken with them i was instructed to use a specific code on the device which pulled up all the recorded data for the device including any issues with the wifi i was able to forward this data to the technician who told me that once reviewed he will call me and let me know how to proceed that was about a month ago and im still waiting meanwhile i decided the problem is within the model itself so ive ordered 2 new devices of the more advanced paperwhite version and returned the other two the problem has appeared on both new devices again couple of hours after ive opened the boxes i have not called customer service again on the new devices the reason is that im tired of spending time on the phone explaining what is the problem and begging for help on the good side i now know my 10 digit wifi password given to me from fios and can tell it without looking it seems that every time i call the rep has a quick fix to connect me to my wifi which works for couple of hours may be after that we are back to hit and miss i now know how to connect the devices to the wifi restart my router and restart the device there are days that even that do not workbut there is always tomorrow however i dont see this as a particularly convenient waythis should not be an issue for a device of such level bottom line im keeping the devices as i really enjoying them as readers my wife doesnt care about the wifi as many people probably dont even Review: i put this kindle side by side with the paperwhite in good lighting the brightness of the screens are fairly identical as the paperwhite adjusts to the light within your environment the darker the room the more prominent the light i do like to read in bed and find that lamp light is sufficient when using this kindle however i must admit that the backlight on the paperwhite is a nice feature and very convenient i got this kindle around valentines day on sale for 5999 and theres no way im returning it unless it malfunctions ill purchase a book light and use it as a backup reader if nothing else on the mechanical side its very sensitive and at times skips a few pages when i tap to advance to the next page from reviews of the paperwhite which was 9999 at the time of my purchase of this kindle the paperwhite has the same issue its a little frustrating trying to get back to your place in the book overall this kindle is a good ereader i recommend that you really evaluate your reading habits before you purchase this kindle if youre used to holding a physical book then theres not much difference here just adjust the light in your environment as usual its lightweight easy to transport and has every feature the paperwhite offers with the exception of the backlight and the higher price tag its also easy on the eyes especially for someone who sits in front of bright computer screen all day and desire to give their eyes a break overall i give this kindle 4 stars it is what it is

frustrated with kindle on its usabilitypros it has more support for nonenglish or western european languages has multiple dictionary for english as well as other languages to choose from vocabulary buildercons not even used for more than a couple of weeks it froze on me i had to restart the system i also lost last read page of my book home page doesnt allow me to go back to my previously read book without searching the book again whenever i navigate say to my cloud or goodread i have to use so many back button to get to where i left off i would think going to the home page would allow me to go back to my book with fewer clicks but no dictionary search limitations  words with dashes or other punctuation are hard to search theres no custom highlight to search words in dictionary  sometimes i need to look up words in dictionary definition too but i cant do that nook has it and i really like the feature where i can search dictionary of words that i dont know everywhere not just the words in the book  custom search sometimes the words you search are not available in regular dictionary or wikipedia but if you modify the search word a little bit it can help but user cannot edit the search word again this is something nook has and i find it very convenient cant disable wifi without going into settings with multiple clicks away from your book then have make more clicks to find your way back to the bookoverall as a reader its not much different than other readers it can improve by increasing dpi making text more clear but other usability is very important too i personally find it hard to use the dictionary usage is very important for someone who is not a native english speaker and need to look up words in dictionary all the time not only the highlighting is rigid not user input to correct the selection and no option for user to search further on new words in definition i simply find it extremely inconvenienti dont think i will buy another kindle in the future

Review: an excellent device that even skeptics will grow to love i love the smell and feel of real books but when i was on vacation i spent a week with no internet connection nor cell phone signal and had to rely on my books to keep me company during this stay i had luckily preemptively downloaded a bunch of books to the device and i plowed straight through 4 or 5 of them this would not have been possible if i had to carry 4 or 5 books on every tripas for the specifications on the device i recommend splurging a bit to get the paperwhite particularly if you like reading at dusk or while traveling this version is pleasant while theres adequate light but if there is inconsistent light say from reading while on a train you will become frustrated the paperwhite with a backlight is much better in this regard in addition i do wish that it was a little bit larger as i have to either hold it with two hands or between my palm and my abductor pollucis meat of the thumb to balance it more nonscreen space for leverage is welcome and would make reading upside down or at angles easiermy last quip about this device is that the exterior scratches fairly easily i left my kindle in my backpack while traveling but it suffered no huge distress and has little scratches that can be distracting from the page definitely recommend purchasing with a cover of some sortthe positivesi love the screen it really does feel like paper and theres about as much readable area as a normal book customizable fonts are nice the area allocated to touch is nice sensitivity is adequate if a bit too much and overall does its job wellthe data transfer system is excellent as i can download books either from amazon or through a third party service and put them on the device via usb easily the experimental browser and goodreads are nice bonuses that i dont really use but you could its very easy to share books with friendsfamily as wellits very light and pleasant to carry around no matter how heavy the reading youre doing isgreat volume lets you read as many books as you want and you can set up a buffet of reading for whatever youre in the mood for rather than being limited by what you have with youoverall recommended but consider the other models first to best match your needs

Review: kindles have been a part of our lives since the first generation kindle reader my son and i are on our 6th kindle boy was i a loyal fan im a librarian and it changed the way we read books and lightened our load when we traveled i probably sold hundreds to friends and family in those first five years just through my vocal enthusiasm for the device i loved showing people how it worked in addition customer service would replace our broken kindles regularly for a small price and we could read and buy books weekly if not sometimes daily fast forward ten years and i am so frustrated with kindles and amazoncom i quit amazon prime this year i dislike the kindle touch reader because any slight touch to the screen gets me completely lost even my son who never complains about anything complains about this kindle and i detest the kindle fire because it stopped holding a charge after 12 months so watching a movie is just a pain i dislike reading books on the fire the light bothers me weve rented dozens of movies and lost at least half of them to that silly 24 hour expiration after you start im sorry but i cant stay awake at night to watch a whole film it sometimes takes awhile and i need that option dont get me started on customer service what used to be wonderful is now awful and time consuming not worth the hassle ive become quite soured on the whole business model plus it doesnt help that the employees of amazon work in harsh conditions with low pay ive listened to a few programs on the radio and on television i think one was 60 minutes and the founder jeff bezos has come under some very harsh criticisms by book sellers publishers and other small businesses competitors as well the reviews on him are not complimentary my two cents think through your purchases estimate how much money youre going to spend in a year on amazon products and if the amazon prime membership is worthwhile figure out how many hours of enjoyment you will get in return for that investment is truly worth your money ive thought it through and for me the answer is clearly no ive been 8 months clean now and im happy with my decision ive chosen to buy less and pay outright for each individual item i deem important enough to own or rent and i still get consistently duped on those movie rentals i dont mind waiting a few extra days for an item to ship either it turns out im still frustrated but at least i have a few more hundred dollars to spend elsewhere now

Review: amazon now has kindles at three price points and this basic model without the selfilluminated display is the perfect beginning point for someone new to ereaders and who might be uncertain about how much they will use the device compared to traditional booksthe display is suitable for normal lighting conditions but not dim light so if intending to use it for reading in bed and without a light by the side of the bed for illumination for example either the paperwhite or voyage might be a better choicethe strengths of this model in addition to the low price are the terrific battery life and the great amount of storage available since there is no demand on the battery to power lighting of the display the normal time span between needed charges is the greatest of any of the kindle ereaders the storage is the same as all of the three models 4 gb which is a tremendous amount of space sufficient for thousands of booksat 79 this can almost be an impulse purchase for many people and if the user later finds that an illuminated display is desired it can be a nice handmedown to someone or kept as a backup devicei have both the paperwhite first generation and voyage models myself noticing that many of the most recent reviews for this entry model are facile and useless i thought that a more informed point of view was needed this is an excellent product and amazon backs it up with superior customer service i can confidently recommend it to anyone who wants to check out what its like to own a kindle who doesnt want to commit too much money right away

Review: great product thus far my first kindle i enjoy not having to hold the pages open and also be able to access new books via amazon account on my computer when i feel inspired to and not having to wait or trek to a library the display is comfortable to read from and easy to navigate although sometimes it can bit a bit challenging in comparison to a full on tablet display although i would take this any day of the week over a tablet for reading regardless of what i just mentioned i enjoy being able to touch anywhere near the edge of the page to turn to the next pagei have not tried other kindle products but do enjoy the newspaper style color scheme it is easy on the eyes im not sure how i would feel about a stark white back ground if that is what the paperwhite model offersbest feature a dictionary at a moments notice by simply highlighting a word you will get an inpage dictionary definitiondiplay with an option for wikipedia info it feels as if i can have a custom footnote at anytime for any word great for many uses also it then keeps track of the words you looked up in a vocabbuilder which is nice to review laterthe fact that the screen is not centered in the itemcase having a thicker dimension below the screen is actually beneficial as it allows the kindlebook pages to not be hidden behind the folds of a blanket for example so i am actually and very happy then it is not symmetrical top to bottomnegative mainly because i really dislike the means and methods of the advertising industry in general the kindle never turns off even if you turn the screen off by morning time there will be a display showing some book or amazon product for sale this feels imposing to my personal space as i often may leave the kindle next to my bed then to wake up and have an advertisement in my room just doesnt feel appropriate of course this is minor and doesnt ruin the product by any means and can easily be fixed by simply turning the device over for example but i wish i didnt have to see the advertisement each and every time as i openunlock my bookkindle just as i am getting relaxedclearing my mind from all the materialism and other issues of the world and am looking forward to reading maybe its an odd thing to mention but i thought it would be worth sharing

Review: some of these did you read the description reviews are a bit harsh considering that many people drawn to a lowcost ereader may have never purchased one before and dont really know what to look for such was the case with my husband who got this for me for christmas i wanted an ereader so i could read a book without being interrupted by texts and other notifications popping up on my screen without having to mess with my phones settings every time i stopped and started reading and so i could read in bed without turning on a lamp or draining my phone battery having zero experience with designated ereaders my husband thought theyd all be like my daughters ipad or our phones lit this is not you can read from this kindle under the same conditions you can read from an actual book no reading without the bedside lamp so that in itself was a dealbreaker for me but some other impressions i had this thing is so lightweight i love that about it also the dictionary and character bio features are awesome i cant tell you how many times ill be reading a book and someone who disappeared in chapter 2 comes back in chapter 12 and i have to go flipping back to chapter 2 to remind myself who he is for the negative though coming from the kindle and nook apps for iphone i love their animated page turns you dont get that with a real kindle for video editors out there the effect is comparable to a onesecond crossdisolve its something id get used to but it felt strange at first but i never did get the hang of paging through my library sometimes it would lag sometimes it would flip perfectly other times i had to try to flip three or four times strange this device also has no kind of contrast control notquitepureblack type on a gray page is a little tough to read but you get what you get i do a lot of graphics work and the slightly bitmapped appearance of some of the larger imagesicons on the page bothered me a lot but im betting most people wouldnt notice or careso if you know what youre looking for and understand what youre getting here a simple ereader without any kind of backlightfrontlight whatever my guess is that youll be perfectly happy because thats what this is but if youve been using a kindle or nook app on a tablet or phone know that this is different it seems like the kindle paperwhite is more of what im looking for so ill try to convince the hubby to upgrade

Review: i have had a kindle fire for a while and have been pleased with it as a tablet but i really wanted a reader specifically they just have a better display for reading especially outside where the glare of the tablet makes it very difficult to read then the debate was regular kindle vs kindle paperwhite i read a ton of reviews on both and watched video reviews and asked people i knew who had them from what i gathered the primary difference is that the paperwhite has an internal light and the regular kindle doesnt oh and the paperwhite is 40 more amazon has an excellent return policy which ive used before and been happy with so i decide to save the 40 and go with the regular kindle knowing that if the lack of a light really bugged me i could return it and get the paperwhite well ive had it two weeks now and i can understand how the light would be useful but i am 100 pleased with my kindle it reads perfectly there are zero issues with the display ive read reviews with the paperwhite having spots in some cases or uneven light and it doesnt bother me in the slightest to read under a lamp i give the kindle 5 stars because it is exactly as marketed what you see is what you get no less no more it reads sooooooo much better than my fire and its lightweight and super easy to useif youre on the fence between a paperwhite and the regular kindle my advice is this if you regularly read in dim lighting not just dark but dim and dont have access to light to read by think about the paperwhite otherwise save the 40 and get the regular its awesome

Review: this is one of the best purchases ive ever made im an avid reader and i love the feel of holding a hard copy book in my hand and turning the pages as i read i am also in the habit of highlighting passages and making margin notes as i read nonfiction which was a big reason for me not having been open to the idea of an electronic book when i read the description of the kindle 6 glarefree touchscreen and saw that it has the highlight and note feature i became more receptive to the idea of an electronic book i chose the glarefree style after some debate because i thought about how difficult it is trying to read the screen of my smart phone outside i told myself i would just use the bedside lamp for night reading over the last couple of years i have gotten into the habit of googling topics on my phone in the dark before going to sleep usually not always i wake up the next morning with a terrible headache the first night i read from my new 6 glarefree kindle with the bedside lamp for light i kept thinking to myself this thing is so comfortable to holdeven lying down i really liked the fact that i could enlarge the font and not have to keep readjusting my glasses while lying on my side because i resized the font enough that i did not have to wear my glasses  the next morning when i woke up after having read for hours on the glarefree kindle my head did not hurt at all now when i read outside i dont have to find a shady spot nor do i have to hold the kindle in weird positions trying to see what is on the screen like i have to do when i try to read my phone screen outside another great thing i love about having many books on the kindle is that instead of dragging along a heavy tote bag full of books on trips i will be able to stick my kindle and my charger in my purse and will still be able to have a choice of what im in the mood to read im so glad i finally decided to try something new after fighting the idea of changing to this newtome way of reading books for so long

Review: i used to be an ereader skeptic until i purchased this kindle as a christmas gift for myself because i dont have enough room to collect books like i normally have right at this point in time i wasnt expecting much just wanted to be able to read the books i would normally buy in paperback in a much more compact way ive fallen in love with this kindle though it takes priority over my cell phone even and i plan to be a kindle user for life probably because this is the best electronic device ive ever boughti have a brain condition that causes migraines on a semiconstant basis so reading off a kindle fire or some other tablet with a backlight was out of the question you need to buy a light to read with this kindle in the dark because it reads exactly like the pages of a book its amazing thats my favorite feature about the whole thing i also like that it has touch page turns buttons would probably make it too bulky its so sleek the way it isi have always had a dictionary handy in case i ever needed to look up a word with the kindle it has a built in dictionary inside of it you highlight by holding down the word and above it pops in a window with the definition its amazing honestly it also pulls up the wikipedia page for whatever word you highlighted even if youre reading a book you manually put on there because it wasnt available in the kindle storeanother amazing feature is the xray you highlight a characters name and it gives you a complete biography of them if you like those fantasyscifi books that come with maps at the beginnings and have tons of hard to pronounce character names you can keep them all straight because of the xray feature however this one only works if you get the book from the kindle storeone thing i dont like is that its so sensitive that if something brushes up against the top ie a cat the font will change sizes randomly and you always have to set it back to your preferred fonti dont know why people make such a fuss about special features i wouldnt pay extra not to have them because i hardly notice them at all i thought the kindle would be too small initially but its really a perfect size its bigger than a dollar store paperback i love how it shows you what percentage you are through of the bookfinally if youre poor but love books like me and you hoard used paperbacks dont be fooled into thinking youre spending less money on books this way because theyre digital theyre cheaper than a new hardback or even a new paperback but theyre not cheaper than a used paperback like i said i also did not have the room to keep hoarding them the way i was which also led me to purchase this kindle however i also think that it is worth paying a couple dollars extra on the digital kindle copy of the book versus the used paperback just for the kindles neat featuresall in all 5 stars this was my favorite gift of christmas by far i will use this for a very very long time

Review: i used to love my kindle until i realized that amazon does not really care about quality of user experienceit is very difficult to send feedback so if there is a problem with the way the system works a specific feature etc there is little recourse and it seems that amazon intentionally makes it hard to find there are lots of problems with the system read below for some examplesthe touch screen and lack of keyboard which makes typing slow and tedious is horrible and imprecise and i detest it i have sent amazon feedback and requested that they continue making the kindle keyboad but they have phased out all nontouch models anyway for many people a touch screen is just not a viable option and for me it is highly annoyinglike when i lean over and strand of my hair brushes the page and skips two chapters ahead completely losing my place in the book wtf making it extremely time consuming to get back to the page i was on without accidentally reading ahead and spoiling it it is especially horrible when that happens in books that have very long chapters or have sections and chapters and have been improperly formatted by the kindle system if dust gets on your screen or a hair or something that cant be blown off with a breath you will have to actually turn the kindle off to remove it or risk hopelessly losing your current pagethe kindle app for android is pretty bad too definitions are rarely displayed properly and when they are it is only the first few words so you have to click and wait for it to load the full definition if you actually want to see word origin or anything useful also the popup could be decent if you could then highlight a word within it and it would show the definition of that but there is actually no way at all to look up a word when viewing the definition of another word because things cannot be highlighted to view definitions from the page it takes you to it is infuriating and the only way that i can see to send feedback is to go through amazoncom and email or call from therethere are so many negatives and outright glitches that just dont get fixed but there is also a huge deficit of useful features that could be easily integrated into the system connection with google drive for example would be an excellent way to organize highlights and notes which are almost useless in the form that the kindle stores and displays themrecently my kindle has been telling me that i cant open more than half of the books that i have purchased from the kindle because they are registered to a different user and i am not looking forward to and dont have time to figure out why thats happeningi have been more and more disappointed with kindle over time but i hope they read this review and actually start trying to get on track again if they dont read this review then i hope google reads it and picks up the torch
